review: I never leave reviews and this is probably my first one. This place was great. Stopped in for something new only to find out they have been there for 8 years or so. Me, My boyfriend and his dad had brunch and it was excellent! Our waitress was sweet and attentive. The Chef, Donna, makes the best biscuits and the frittatas were amazing as well!  Would highly recommend this place for anyone wanting a solid breakfast/ brunch. We will definitely be back to try their other menus!

This place is a block from our apartments and one of those "we should stop in one day" type places. It was my birthday weekend and we decided to finally stop in for brunch. Everything was perfect. I got the shrimp and grits and my partner got the pancakes. The shrimp and grits were a huge plate with sausage, biscuit and eggs. The pancakes came with eggs and turkey bacon and we each had tea and a juice. Everything was so flavorful and delicious. The pancakes especially were amazing so fluffy and light but tasty. I dont usually like pancakes but will prob order them next time, a few bites of my partners was not enough. The staff was very friendly without being in your face and the orange juice was fresh and delicious. All in all we both wanted to take our moms here the next time they come by, high praise indeed. :) we will def be back

It kills me to give this spot a beyond low rating because I really wanted to love it but OMG, stay away until they get it together. I first walked in and there were zero customers which I thought would be cause for either a great service experience or just an overall poor experience, and it was the latter for me. The 'cook' was chilling at one of the tables until our order was taken by the hostess. She was very sweet but was beyond unorganized when other customers began to come in. The cook obviously didn't want to be there since it was Christmas Eve but hey, you chose to be employed, so do your job with a smile. I even overheard him complaining when other customers came in. I ordered the fish and grits, French toast and shrimp and grits. The fish was flavorless and soggy, the shrimp were undercooked and the French toast was hard as rocks. I have no problem with paying for what my food is worth but I feel like the food is extremely overpriced to be this crappy. Maybe if the 'cook' had a better attitude, my food would've tasted halfway decent. I use the word cook in quotations because he looked like some random man who threw on an apron and expected to deliver but failed. Please don't waste your money coming to this establishment.

Iight so boom. I was looking for a real homely restaurant to celebrate Fathers Day. My father and my grandmothers like authentic, homemade cooking. Nothing overly processed, just some good ol cooking from a chef in the back that you know you can trust. And let me tell you something, Home Sweet Harlem is just that.I had a reservation for a party of 5, which accommodated myself, my mother, father and two grandmothers (80 and 88 years old). Upon arrival a staff member asked if outdoor seating would be okay for us as it was currently all they had available. I normally don't mind outdoor seating especially when the weather was as beautiful as it was. But my grandmothers prefer A/C and comfortable indoor seating. However, as all the tables were full we would've had to wait 30-40 minutes for an indoor table to be full. Well guess what, not no more! As soon as I expressed my grandmothers wishes they quickly worked together to arrange for seating inside the restaurant. A restaurant and staff members that truly care about the comfort and safety of their patrons is an establishment I can respect.Now onto the food. When I tell you this food is made FRESH. Like, when we sat down our server Jen asked for patience as they just made a fresh batch of pancake mix and biscuit dough. Like hello?!! FRESH PEOPLE! The sangria? Made freshhhhh! The Bellini...FRESH PEACH PURÉE! Honestly it's so scarce to find restaurants in the city with good old southern, authentic, comfort food. Man oh man. We ordered some biscuits for the table and they were flaky, buttery, cheddary, and just delicious. We opted for the full brunch which is $24 per person and includes your entree (which is already stacked) and your selection of: Turkey Bacon, Turkey Sausage, or fresh Salmon Cake AND choose a Mimosa, Bellini, Michelada or Fresh Squeezed Orange or Mango Juice, too!! Like my goodness! The menu is everything you can imagine. Shrimp or fish and grits, pancakes, challah French toast, eggs, potatoes liiiikkkeee. Again. Fresh.And let me tell you about the fresh. Not only is it made to order but it is SEASONED!!! FLAVOR!!! Hot and ready and just my goodness. Let me tell you something. I recommend this place 10/10. Family oriented, girls meet up, date day. The vibes are here, the music is classic and the staff is lovely.

I've been meaning to go to Home Sweet Harlem for a while now and it did not disappoint. It's very spacious & comfortable.  The service was great and the chef was super sweet.  I felt like I was eating at my aunty's.  I'll be back.

The decor inside gave a true New York feeling! The food was amazinggggggg!!! I had the fish and grits and the texture of the fish was cooked perfectly ! The grits were not lumpy and the eggs were amazing!!! The chef was a joy and very delightful to interact with! The staff are so friendly and attentive I couldn't help but fall in love !!! I will definitely be back to this restaurant when I visit Harlem again and if I do say so myself those who are in Harlem visiting or even a resident should definitely try this place!!!!!!
I went here with my three teenage kids and we have a great meal and great service. The menu for brunch was very tasty. And the coffee was incredible. I will definitely come back.

Gotta say I was expecting better from here based on reviews! Used to live near here in Harlem and thought it was very convenient so had to check it out!Had high hopes but this place is a bit pricey, service is really slow(but nice staff), and the food isn't much to rave about. I think I'd feel differently if the food was WOW but it wasn't one of those worth the wait spots. Really wanted to like this place but don't know if I really would recommend it to others and may stick to other spots in central harlem instead.

I would advise to stay away from this place at all costs until they get it together unless you want to waste an hour of your morning. We sat for 40 minutes after waiting 15 minutes for water. There were three servers and about 5 tables sat. To me that math says that staff either doesn't know or doesn't care. I also walked up and politely asked to order about a half hour in and they assured me someone was coming over. Another 15 minutes later of being ignored we walked to dear mama manhattanville. Save yourself some time and start there instead.

We went for brunch.The menu was not up to date... it didn't have chicken and waffles on there but according to the server, they offered it. Also the menu had mimosaa and bellinis and sangrias as options but according to the server they didn't have their liquor license so no alcohol was allowed. So confusing. Overall, The server was friendly and jovial but he messed up our order a few times. Also it took over an hour for our food to come out and the appetizers didnt even come out before the main food.... Everything came out all at once. The food was good Though. The chicken was well seasoned and the French toast was decent. The fresh squeezed orange juice was good though could have been colder. The cook did come out from the back to apologize to us for the delay and for the waiter getting the orders wrong. That was a nice gesture.

I had the Fish and Grits Lunch and it was substandard! The service was nice but very, very slow. My fish is dry and over cooked, my eggs are burnt and the grits are lumpy as hell.I'm not sure why this place has so many stars,

Spotted restaurant while driving by. Pulled car over to check Yelp reviews and felt compelled to check out the grits. I'm not accustomed to the availability of grits in a restaurant outside of the South (U.S.). For starters, the young man at the front counter/bar was welcoming, friendly, helpful & attentive. The culinarilly gifted lady from behind the scenes showed similar attributes as I got situated in the restaurant.

This place doesn't seem to be what it used to be but perhaps the pandemic changed it. The waitstaff were nice and all but I still don't understand why took so long to place our order when there were just 3 of us in the place. I was a bit disappointed in my own meal  but at 10 dollars I couldn't be that mad. The salmon croquettes were delicious.
Love this place!! Got the shrimp and grits which were delicious. The biscuit is one of the best I've had! Thanks to our amazing server K for your excellent service!

Went for brunch when playing soccer nearby.Honestly can't understand why this place has 4 stars overall.Pros - it's light and airy when you walk in, and the server was nice and friendly.The food was really pretty average. All brunch items were $16,  and we tried 4 different things.I had pancakes and was expecting an impressive plate- I was very underwhelmed for the price.The other dishes came with turkey sausage / eggs etc but the sides all appeared to have been made a day or 2 earlier and partially reheated.2 dishes had a few bits of side salad which also seemed to have been prepped the day before and refrigerated by the look of them.Overall I guess if you are in the area it's nicer than many other spots. But don't go out of your way...

I had a great time! The food was flavorful, healthy, it was hot and fresh. The chef suggested the blackened fish, roasted potatoes, and sautéed greens medley. The perfect choice. I will visit again! owner and stuffs were the most hospitable, and I really appreciate their service!

We had shrimp and grits, delicious. Sweet potatoes were naturally caramelized without added sugar. Coffee was nice and strong too. The owner took time to check in with us several times and staff was friendly and attentive as well. If you find yourself in Harlem, don't miss this place!

Today my husband, and our three children had brunch at HOME SWEET HARLEM. I felt so welcomed. My seven year old daughter asked if we could come back EVERY SUNDAY.  Ms. Donna was so friendly. The staff was very attentive and the food was delicious. Delicious. I had pancakes with salmon cakes and eggs. My husband had French toast with salmon cakes and eggs. My children had cheese grits. I also had a side of sautéed shrimp with a biscuit.  I am hoping we can go EVERY SUNDAY.

3.5 starsFood: The food is pretty average to me. It is good but not out of this world.Drink: unlimited mimosa/bellini option available. Pretty average as well.Service: the service was pretty slow but we LOVED our waiter. He had the best personality and made our brunch a lot of fun. We weren't in a rush so the fact that the service was a bit slow didn't phase us.Atmosphere: very comfy. It wasn't too crowded when we went. Don't expect luxury but you can count on comfort.
Dont go for weekend brunch, no liquor license. Food was cold and the table was dirty.
Love this place!! Got the shrimp and grits which were delicious. The biscuit is one of the best I've had! Thanks to our amazing server K for your excellent service!

Would never come here again, and to be honest, would be surprised if this place survived the post pandemic opening. Would not recommend to anyone else.

Workers are lovely. Food is banging. This was my first time here and everything was great. They didn't need to plaster on a fake front of being overly "customer service forward" to the point of no longer feeling like Nyc. I hate it when people aren't just them. Love it here and would totally be back. New York vibes are chill and I love that this place matches that. Keep up being amazing, even during a pandemic.

What a great restaurant with down home food! Brunch was delightful!! Excellent service coupled with supreme recipes and exceptional presentation.

We love Home Sweet Harlem! The food is exceptional, (you could really taste the quality behind the ingredients), and the service is great. We were particularly impressed with the values of the place. We were so satisfied with our experience, we hope to be back soon and bring our family members to come and try the very delightful and pleasant Home Sweet Harlem.
Do not order delivery from here! They use ghost kitchens and end up hours behind with too many orders. It's not worth the stress.

I was in the neighborhood, so stopped by to test Home Sweet Harlem out. The vibe is great. After going through the reviews I got Sweet Potato Pie, and it was so great, it is now my favorite dish. The employees here are helpful, too. My family will certainly become the regular customers at Home Sweet Harlem.

When I walked in it smelled like my grandmothers kitchen. And the chef came out and greeted me with a smile and a shimmy. She had on that grandma auntie head wrap too... I ain't even try the food yet but by the looks of that head wrap, it's gon be FIRE! The bartender was joyful and welcoming. The sangria HAS BLUEBERRIES IN IT !!! Praise him... sorry caught the Holy Ghost real quick. Can't wait to eat ya'll!--------So boom: I had the fish and grits with a salmon cake. Mad delicious, but def not my grandmothers grits. They were good tho. The fish was perfect. But that salmon cake.... praise the lordt. Amazing. The biscuit was terrible. It was cold and did not taste good at all. Service was great. Bae had an omelette with spinach and cheese, he really enjoyed it. He loved the coffee! He also hated his biscuit though. He loved his potatoes too. Overall: I still give it 5 stars- it was clean, smelled great, the music was amazing cuz I'm a 50 year old living in a 26 year old body ... I will be back!

Absolutely fantastic- great service, so friendly, top notch food. I had the challah French toast, which was perfection, with fresh whipped cream, that I could tell was made from scratch, and they steamed the milk for my coffee. Also had eggs and turkey sausage with it, which sometimes can be a weird flavor, but here it was great, couldn't tell it was turkey sausage. It's a little pricey but completely worth it in my opinion. Also, lovely atmosphere, very cozy, cool artwork on the walls. I'll definitely be back for sure!

I had the challah French toast, which was perfection, with fresh whipped cream, that I could tell was made from scratch, and they steamed the milk for my coffee. Also had eggs and turkey sausage with it, which sometimes can be a weird flavor, but here it was great, couldn't tell it was turkey sausage. It's a little pricey but completely worth it in my opinion. Also, lovely atmosphere, very cozy, cool artwork on the walls. I'll definitely be back for sure!
The best fish and grits in town hands down, treat yourself to it some time you will not regret it.

I hate leaving a review like this. But I usually love this place. The owner was very sweet in person. The food was spot-on in person. But this weekend I ordered delivery of shrimp and grits. It was more like shrimp and tomato watery soup with sage. I had to throw it out. It was not appetizing at all.

There is no way that anyone who ate here is giving this place 4 stars. The food is basic and the overall restaurant operation is on the struggle bus.For example, at brunch, my table ordered ice tea. We're drinking the ice tea and it tastes weird. I turn to my cousin "Does this ice tea taste like garlic?" Ladies and gentlemen, they were storing garlic in the ice tea machine and it tastes awful. We had to wait for 20 minutes for new ice tea. The breakfast burrito was all brown and looked weird. We had to remind the wait staff at least 15 times to bring condiments to our table. The food took forever to come out. I wanted to support a local place but this is not it.

My favorite brunch spot of all time, have been going here for yearssss. Haven't been in over a year due to Covid and moving but will definitely be returning this week and I cannot wait!! Shrimp and grits are the best I ever had. Biscuits are to die for and the salmon cakes? Mouth watering goodness!!!!!

Pretty disappointed in this place. Came here for some brunch, the reviews looked amazing! Ended up let down. First off, the service. There was only two other people sitting in the restaurant. For a restaurant that adds automatic service charge, we expected more service wise. Things that were good: fresh squeeze OJ was amazing, love that they had that on the menu. Sweet potato homfries/yams were delicious and cooked perfectly. Things that were not so good: service, shrimp and grits were ATROCIOUS. Please do not order them especially if you're on from the south. I really should have sent them back but the food takes so long here when it's was very slow... I can't imagine how it is when the restaurant is busy. But yes shrimp and grits had no flavor at all. The grits were very watery and chunky not creamy and buttery like they should be. Turkey bacon.. well it was turkey bacon how goo could that be  lastly... the biscuit was so damn small I was offended. The restaurant vibe is really cute it just needs lots of work service/food wise.

If I could give zero stars, I would. I try to support black businesses. I really do. But it's people like this that give black businesses an unfair reputation of being unprofessional. I even gave them two chances in hopes that the first time was just a fluke. In my first order, I ordered the "Home skillet" that is supposed to be shrimp and grits. Well, they didn't include the grits in the bag. ???? How does that even work leaving out the grits in shrimp and grits? When I called them to complain, I spoke with someone named "Donna," who sounded like she didn't even know where she was or what year it is. I asked her if she was okay, because she sounded like someone stole her brain cells. Grubhub was kind enough to refund this order. Then I ordered a second time. This time, I ordered griddle cakes that are supposed to come with syrup (obviously) and cream. The griddle cakes arrive without syrup and cream. When I called them to ask what happened, I get "Donna" again, who sounds as spaced out as she did the first time. So, I asked to speak to the owner or manager. The owner gets on the phone after Donna just put the phone down without even telling me she was getting the owner. The owner then proceeds to tell me that I was a liar and that there is no way she can tell if I didn't get the syrup. Really? I have spent numerous hundreds of dollars on take out since the pandemic started in NYC, and I can count on one hand the number of times I've had missing items from my orders and was issued a refund - and I wouldn't use all of my fingers on that one hand either! There is no reason for me to lie. I have the money to spend on take out. And I see it as a way to help the restaurants and small businesses in the area who have suffered as a result of the pandemic. But noooooooo, these unprofessional idiots proceed to act ignorant and call me a liar. They need customer service 101 ASAP. Sadly, people who conduct business this way will be the first ones to say people don't support black businesses. NO ONE should be supported who behave like this toward their customers. So deuces, Sweet Home Harlem. You will never get another dime of my money. I tried to support you, and you failed MISERABLY.

Located right by CUNY and the 135 subway stop we were thrilled to discover this little oasis in the neighborhood. So charming, airy and friendly. The brunch was well priced and my french toast with fresh berries was one of the best I've ever had. The owner even swung by the table (she's obviously hard at work in the kitchen as well) to say hi and seemed genuinely happy how much we enjoyed our meal. I'll definitely be back.

This place is disgusting unclean and dishonest!!! I ordered from Grubhub and they are illegally using a different name of ThickChick which I will be filing a complaint about. However I placed an order for chicken sandwiches which were absolutely disgustingly dry burned and tasteless. I asked for all of of my sandwich dressings to be put on the side and it arrived with a whole bunch of ingredients I did not ask for!Stay away from this place the food is nasty inedible!They are using a different name on Grubhub!Location is filthy! Yes 1528 Amsterdam Ave!If I had know the place was actually Home Sweet Harlem I would have never ordered!

Workers are lovely. Food is banging. This was my first time here and everything was great. They didn't need to plaster on a fake front of being overly "customer service forward" to the point of no longer feeling like Nyc. I hate it when people aren't just them. Love it here and would totally be back. New York vibes are chill and I love that this place matches that. Keep up being amazing, even during a pandemic.
Food was outstanding. We had a great conversation with the owner.  We willBe back again. This is a must go to spot. Love it. Fell in love with Harlem.

I was in the neighborhood, so stopped by to test Home Sweet Harlem out. The vibe is great. After going through the reviews I got Sweet Potato Pie, and it was so great, it is now my favorite dish. The employees here are helpful, too. My family will certainly become the regular customers at Home Sweet Harlem.

This place is so wonderfully underrated! I 100% recommend swinging by this place for brunch if you're in the Harlem area. It's family owned from what I can tell and the servers and managers are so sweet. They were also open on 4th of July which I appreciated since my friends and I were hungry and lurking. I will say, I was a little shocked at how pricey this place was. Everything on the menu had a range of $15-20, which isn't crazy for New York, but the bottomless mimosas were $24 which was a little steep. I ordered the breakfast burrito and I'm not exaggerating when I say I think it was the best breakfast burrito I've ever had in my life. I'm not completely positive on what exactly was in it, and which ingredient gave me this ethereal experience, but if you come here you have to order it. The burrito was also the perfect size and the home fries were delicious.

Right between my daughter's two graduations and a 2 hour gap... we were just downright hungry. She suggested coming here for a bite to eat since it's right across from City College.We didn't make reservations as we were caught in the middle of excitement, but once in, the Manager? Owner? told us right from the get-go, that we needed to wait a bit and clear a table for us. Excellent. Home Sweet drips with down home food with a little flair. Fast and pleasant service, an interesting Southern but eclectic Menu and a really nice looking design- all made the afternoon stand out. Large wooden counter with chairs and a couple of café tables to your right. Exposed brick wall and lots more seating- on the left with this round, fabric covered seating sofa booth in the back. Brunch Menu was substantial with a good price. My Mom and my husband enjoyed their Croissant Sandwiches with turkey sausages, my daughter managed with a side of Roasted Potatoes as her only vegan option. And my Feta & Spinach Frittata, was very good with a side of Roasted Yams. Before I forget- love how Home Sweet uses fresh Yams and not canned! Our server really kept us in the loop and mentioned- that because there was a larger party before us, Home Sweet needed to service them first. Excellent. I rather hear that- than nothing at all! This is another return for me......if I'm in the area. Lots of pluses here and also liked how Home Sweet explicitly details on their menu and receipt- there's no tipping but a service charge is added! Excellent again. Oh and by the way- Home Sweet doesn't serve Beef or Pork. And just for that and so many other reasons...this place is Rocking!

Solid four stars! This place is a haven for home cooked meals that warm your heart.  The dishes are served very much like the portions your favorite grandma/auntie would give you. Large, piping hot dishes of love that you really shouldn't finish but you do because you don't want to disappoint (millions of gluttons were born this way). The owner can often be found cooking in the back. A warm slice of sweet potato pie is almost always offered as dessert because it's house made and a true delight. If you've lived in Harlem long enough you'd remember that there was an incarnation of this resto on 135th between 7th & 8th Avenues. This pie and this owner cling to ones memory like the food will cling to your heart, in a good way of course.By the way, this is a non-tipping establishment. This didn't stop me from leaving a tip because the hospitality is like nowhere else. Be warned, this is not a place to hop in and out of for a quick meal. If you come here, you're welcome to linger and get comfortable whether at a booth or at the counter. There is a sign that will subtly let you know that fresh pressed/squeezed juice is also made here. Oh the juiciest of oranges and strawberries and sweet bananas and crisp-green kale (!!) can be assuredly found here. Settle in and feed your body. You will surely enjoy all that is to be found here. The decor is rustic, homey and somewhat kitsch-y, but it works.Don't be fooled by the humble, simple decor and feel at home in Home Sweet Harlem.

I was taken here for my birthday yesterday and the food and service exceeded any expectations I had coming in.Our server was detail oriented, kind, and an absolute sweet heart. We ordered the full brunch meal and omg, it was DELICIOUS !!!The French toast was to die for !!!!I got it with all the works; fresh fruit, Nutella, scrambled eggs with cheese, Turkey bacon, and a side of grits.Our drinks were just as refreshing as the food was tasty !! You could tell every thing was made with love and I can't wait to come back !!!!Thank you all for a wonderful birthday dinner
Great dinner options, dinner served all day + always happy to support a Black Woman Owned Business! We'll definitely be back.

I would love to give a review on the food but unfortunately this place cannot seem to open on time. Not once but twice!! I made a reservation for 9am so I can have breakfast after a long 12 hour night shift and was told they were "opening". When I asked what time that was they said about another hour but wasn't certain. This same exact thing happened in the summer and I was given a similar excuse. Sad to say this will be my last attempt at this place. Like the saying says - fool me twice shame on me.

I was excited to eat here until we walked in. Really sad service. The hostess acted as if she didn't want us to enter or sit down, the waitress attitude was nasty, they served us drinks that were dirty (as in there were food remanentes alllll on the glass) the table wasn't clean. Couldn't even stay. We paid for the beverages we didn't drink and quickly left without even eating. Shouldn't have even paid for that. Don't even bother coming to this establishment. Such an embarrassment to Harlem.

My cousins and I stumbled upon this place via Yelp for a cute brunch while they were in town for the holidays (Thanksgiving weekend). All the other places were booked up for that Saturday so we decided to come here. -We arrive and the place is empty. Like EMPTY empty. No other customers. So as a person who has worked in several cafés and restaurants, your brunch place shouldn't be empty on a Saturday. (Red flag #1). -It smelled like fresh paint. (Red flag #2)-The coffee was lukewarm and the sugar was hard. As a former barista, I know that only stale sugar is hard. (Red flag #3)The menu is sort of lack luster. We did not stay long enough to order food. My cousins ordered sangria and got one refill each. We found a better place to eat. And asked for the check. The initial check came out to $25. While gathering the money and using the bathroom before we headed out, a different employee came and dropped off "the correct check"- $55?!! (She then crumpled up the $25 receipt and proceeded to walk away)We asked where this extra $30 charge came from and she replied "I don't know- thats what it is?"EXCUSE ME!?We asked to speak to the manager, who came and clarified everything. Somehow the total was $45 for 2 coffees and 3 sangrias. Which is still too damn high. But whatever. ALSO- this place is CASH ONLY. It was not indicated on Yelp nor Google. In conclusion, we won't ever dine here again...

The food is not what you expect it to be, the worst. I had a table of 5. No one never came to seat us, wasn't waited until 30-45 minutes after sitting there. Now back to the food, only 1 dish was made completely fine, sad right? There were two orders of Callah French Toast, bread was hard like a rock, bacon was not turkey bacon (i eat turkey bacon all the time at home i know the difference) . There was bees all over the table my guests and I were sitting. Won't see my guests and I again.

I can't believe we ignored this Harlem gem for a couple of years now. This will  be our new brunch place to go to! The home frittata was delicious 10/10 and the challah french toast = legit 100%!I would give this business 10 stars if I can! If you are reading this, you just need to go and try the greatness! Remember cash only policy, support your local businesses!

From the moment we walked into the door until we left we felt at home. Great food. Loved loved that the owner/chef personally came out and welcomed this Texas native. We will be back. I had the shrimps and grits with unlimited mimosas.
super good. shrimp and grits brunch was amazing. biscuit was beautiful mmm and the drinks were great :)

My daughter has been to HSH several times, and that is where she wanted to go for her 18th birthday.  Well, we brought the whole family for her celebration brunch.  Some of us had sweet, and some of us had savory, but we were all delighted.  Everyone loved their meal, and it was a great place for  a celebration.  There was something for everyone on the menu.  Plus, icing on the cake, they were super nice and told us a secret ingredient!  We will go back gladly.
What a great restaurant with down home food! Brunch was delightful!! Excellent service coupled with supreme recipes and exceptional presentation.
Do not order delivery from here! They use ghost kitchens and end up hours behind with too many orders. It's not worth the stress.

18% Service charge is INCLUDED for every table no matter the number of people that are seated! You are not verbally informed that there's a service charge. There was no service !I should have left when I saw another table leaving without ordering. Service - I was unsure if I was at a school ground for friends to congregate or a place of business. They all seemed to go outside chatting it up and forgetting to place your order or even inform their own waitress that she/he has a table. There's lemonade on the written menu - but no lemonade. We only had 3 orders in total and still I got potatoes instead of grits. There was no spring water.... I can go on!Food & Drinks - Health hazard - the cup with the coffee was chipped. You could use the biscuit as a weapon it was so hard. The salmon cakes were burnt and they offered KETCHUP of all things with the salmon cakes. Needless to say I had to eat it dry. The portions are small. Two dime size biscuits and the salmon cakes are okay in size. The farmer omelette was just ok. Facilities - so I'm not sure what men go to the bathroom for, but for females it primarily to check their make up or to do a quick selfie. Forget that the bathroom ain't clean, the bathroom is dark. The star was only for accommodating moving tables, twice.
Very decent. Small menu but tasty. A little pricey, but comprable to other places like it in and around Harlem.

Haven't had such awful service for a while.Went on a Saturday morning for brunch. The food was decent, $15 for a brunch entry. Service was extremely slow, only one waiter running around. Food finally arrived, waiter forgot to bring cream to my coffee. Asked for a coffee refill, waiter took my coffee cup and never returned. Check arrived with 18% service charge added. I wonder if they have a clue how unsatisfied customers are.Also, there are two bathrooms on premise, however the lady in the kitchen poured waste water in one bathroom sink. How gross.Will not return.

Wow I feel very violated. I ordered a Cob salad and my chicken was raw. All of it. There was no cheese. NO CHEESE. The bacon was scarce. No  dressing not even some oil. No utensils. No straw for my ice coffee. The potatoes were fine. They charged $32 for all this. I'm appalled

The food was great! I loved the fish and grits. I was hoping for slightly more creamy grits, but what came out was great. The fish was lightly breaded and crispy and the turkey bacon was just right as well. Didn't care for the biscuit. It was super hard and dry. Also, a chef made it a point that we could order sangria when we first walked in, which was nice. It was delicious! Will definitely go back and recommend to friends.

There was a pretty extensive Thanksgiving dinner special here and, being socially distanced for this holiday, I opted in. I reserved my food and got turkey, cranberry sauce and stuffing with a choice of appetizer, sides and dessert. There side portions were great and the turkey was moist. My immediate favorites were the beans and stuffing (neither of which made it to leftover status). The stuffing was made with cornbread and veggies which is a treat for me as I don't have this often. I opted for the lightly candied yams (I appreciated that they weren't drowned in syrup but still had a good crust). I also thoroughly enjoyed my appetizer of corn pudding. The sweet potato pie was just ok and greens were alright, I added a bit of apple cider vinegar to dress them up. I wasn't crazy about the mac but I understand that tends to be preferential. All in all, I loved being able to have a slice of the holiday all in one packaged meal. I even went back the next day for an extra side of stuffing, which they happily provided. Fingers crossed this is available around Christmas as well!!

We love Home Sweet Harlem! The food is exceptional, (you could really taste the quality behind the ingredients), and the service is great. We were particularly impressed with the values of the place. We were so satisfied with our experience, we hope to be back soon and bring our family members to come and try the very delightful and pleasant Home Sweet Harlem.

Awww... its hurts to write this cause I wanted this place to be good. Maybe it was just my experience or the menu item, or bad timing but I'm kinda one and done, in & out with this place. My friend and I ordered the Chicken & Waffles along with unlimited mimosas/bellinis after an enthusiastic suggestion was made by a manager only to be super disappointed by the outcome. The crazy thing is I had no intentions of getting Chicken & Waffles cause the menu along with other people's food looked pretty descent ... So this place must take the concept of Chicken & Waffles literally cuz I was in fact served only One Piece of Chicken with my waffle... (YES only 1 piece!!) I ain't never been to a spot where I've only gotten ONE Piece of Chicken wit my waffle!?! ... insult to injury, it was some indecipherable part of the chicken; the back maybe? ... and it wasn't even good or flavorful... super greasy and all crisp... Super Super disappointing to say the least. I asked the waiter bout the one piece of chicken after being served, he told me it would be $4 for an extra piece! I'll pass. The waffle? Blah at best. The mimosas & bellinis? Descent at best. The Check? Ridiculous. Not enough heart to give Home Sweet Harlem a second chance...  And ain't it might not be such a bad idea if nevaaaa, never went home again (Gil Scott-Heron voice)

Had a decent brunch here, though our waitress was terrible. I had a frittata (forget the exact name) with grits, and my friend had the Farmer's Skillet with potatoes and an orange juice. I liked hers a little better - the eggs had a better flavor and the potatoes trumped the grits. Overall, the food was tasty and filling. My favorite part was the biscuit!It's too bad about our waiter, who was super inattentive though it wasn't busy. She also didn't tell us it was cash only (that day) until it was time to pay. Ouch.

Great egg and cheese on croissant! The place is classy but comfortable. I would love to hang out here for a couple hours with a good book. They've got a full brunch menu plus juices and some alcohol. The owner is very nice, too.

I've had shrimp and grits all over the south. It's a rather wonderful mix of creamy, briny, and succulent. Some places over do it with one part or another. It's a difficult balance to maintain. But not Home Sweet Harlem. It's the perfect plate of shrimp and grits. The balance is only second to that of the most highly trained ninjas. You'd be better off punching your self in the junk than pass up this, of what really can only be described as, sex on a plate.

On Saturday I was a part of a group of mentors that brought about 16 middle-schoolers down to the city from Syracuse to teach them about the Harlem Renaissance. So, it seemed only fair that we'd catch brunch in the area. Based on majority of the reviews, we chose this place. Short version: Many of the menu items were missing. "Fresh-squeezed" orange juice is Tropicana which they make no effort to hide. Syrup is like water. Pancakes have no flavor. French toast is lackluster. Somehow on their planet, a bowl of oatmeal is the same $15 price as a Home Skillet meal. Service is terrible. Tables are rickety and the music is barely audible. Long version: I know that servers typically abhor large parties but the service here was next-level rude. After being told that it was cash only, one of the mentors went to the atm next door to get cash while everyone else got seated. We were given one pitcher of water to serve over 20 people. I already peeped how this was going to go. We then waited for about 20 minutes before our waiter came. He started off by telling us that we're a big crowd so we needed to give him a break. He took our orders in a clockwise fashion. Halfway through the orders, another waiter offered to take the first sheet of orders so the cook could begin and but he refused. Among the options we were told they didn't have: $15 oatmeal, Ginger Mint water and though the menu advertised waffles, they didn't have a waffle maker so any orders for waffles were turned into bland, burnt-edge pancakes. While we waited for our food for about half an hour, our waiter never came over to the table. We had to flag him down multiple times to request some more water and he behaved like he was doing us some kind of favor and told us we had to wait because he was doing something as he went back over to the bar to talk with a coworker. When our food finally came, our waiter slammed down two pitchers of water on the table. One pitcher had what looked like carrot shavings in it. He came back and gave us one cup of whipped cream and a vessel of syrup and told us we had to share, though most people had either French toast or pancakes. Looking at it, we knew that it wasn't enough to serve everyone and right away asked for more. He just laughed and walked away. One of my children's orders was never placed by the waiter and there was no apology. We were simply told that the chef would start cooking it now. Her French toast took about another 15 minutes. The waiter himself never came to assist with distributing food so whoever was in the kitchen coming out had no idea who ordered what. I eventually saw him leaving the restaurant. I guess his shift was over and he couldn't be bothered to let us know. Thankfully, we had already requested the bill. For those who had the Home Skillet, grits and potatoes, they were pretty alright. Everything else was bland or cold. One mentor didn't eat any of the shrimp that came with his meal. There was only one other waitress who came to check on us during our meal and brought me some hot sauce to put with my eggs. This single star is for her. The only thing my mentors seemed to like were the mimosas because either the restaurant running out of Tropicana or the goal was to get people tipsy, but it was basically cheap champagne with about a tablespoon of OJ for color. Throughout our time there, about three other groups of people came to eat and left without placing their meals. I envied them. I will never again visit this restaurant and if you're reading this, save yourself the trouble.

My friends and I were looking for a vegetarian/vegan friendly restaurant in HarlemFor brunch. We took a chance on Home Sweet Harlem. As soon as we walked in the staff were friendly and accommodating. They answered all of our many questions and the chef and owner was happy to accommodate one of party's dietary needs. The food itself was delicious! It was perfectly seasoned and visually appealing. The cocktails were also perfect. The owner even chatted with us for awhile on our way out. I highly recommend this place and we'll definitely be back!
Always a pleasure to come to Home Sweet Harlem. Daisy is an absolute angel. She is kind and attentive. She's awesome. Love, love, love the shrimp and grits.
The shrimp and grits are to die forThe home skillet is ridiculously good. The service is impeccable. I just found my new brunch spot

Get the whole wheat hot cakes with organic syrup!!Get the turkey bacon!!...and a sho'nuff must: get the salmon cake!!And the 1 hour unlimited Bellini ain't a bad deal either!!...found a new Harlem go-to...

A cozy atmosphere ideal for small groups or dates looking to do an early brunch. But, considering the prices, a little on the underwhelming side.  I ordered the French toast with a side of turkey sausage and 2 fried eggs. The French toast was definitely fluffy as advertised, and quite hearty, but the lack of sweet flavor begged to be accompanied by syrup as it was still on the "plain" side. Sausages were hot and juicy, although they only gave 2 small links. The eggs however were served to me dry and cold. Mind you, these sides were a $10 addition from just getting the French toast by itself.  Can't complain about the drinks though. Highly recommend the sangria especially. The service was good and our waiter kept everything going nicely with a friendly attitude. However, they say they already charge a service charge as stated on the menu that's supposed to cover the tip. Once we got our checks, we had to inquire on whether or not tips were included due to how they wrote our bills. Everything was decent but just seemed a little too unorganized and lackluster for what they expect you to pay.

On my second day in NY, I stopped here because it had some good reviews and it seemed like a cool place! Hahaha I've never been to Harlem before so I wanted to try something here.Right away from entering, I got this hip, 20-something crowd vibe, so this is probably a popular spot for them. The server sat us down but she had to clean the table because it was dirty... she did a few huge swipes with this wet towel and then it dried up. I kind of.... didn't want to see that. I have them the better judgment that someone just left and they didn't have time to clean it up- not a big deal to me!I ordered the home skillet with a salmon cake and a side of sweet potatoes. The food look 40 minutes to get to our table, probably a little longer ban that! Server told us that she never put the order in with the cook so she just ended up taking our orders again. Super unprofessional, I was so disappointed. She brought us out biscuits while we waited again and one of them HAD A HAIR baked into it... I should have just walked out at that point but I was hungry! Food was delicious though, was very hot and tasty. Probably the only reason why I gave them 3 stars and not one.Server insisted she would discount order and only took 2 dollars off. I was fed up, I definitely won't be back.

I'm from Jersey and I found this place on Yelp and Google. So, I decided to take the trip out to Harlem. We came here for Sunday brunch on a beautiful Sunday. William was our server and superceded out expectations with his customer service. He made sure that our mimosas were never empty. I ordered the griddle cakes, eggs, salmon cake and roasted potatoes and definitely need a nap now. My friends ordered the fish & grits and the home skillet with shrimps. The other two looked too good, but we started eating b4 we took the picture. The food (very seasoned) and the drinks were good. I'd definitely come back and recommend!

Listen, it all started well! There were three of us, seated immediately, so super excited there! After visiting another restaurant with a 90 minute wait. Waitress and host were super attentive from the start. Then things started getting a little rough. We ordered food took 45 minutes to come then their POS went down, so only cash...luckily I had cash on me and this didn't effect me--but dang that table of 10 across from us. Food was pretty good, salmon croquettes came cold.
Food was great! Could've did without the salad but everything else was good. Nice ambiance with cool art. Waiter was great!

Who's mom is cooking at the back? This place is a homely family oriented restaurant. Staff are friendly & really want you to feel welcomed. Let's talk about the food!!! I was so pleased when I ordered the home skillet, because it was filling & super delicious. My sister in a law kept saying "who's mom is cooking in the back?". The food is homemade everything down to the pancakes. When I tell you, the biscuits are amazing, I mean amazing. My only critic if I had to give one is I wished my biscuit was a little bigger. Overall definitely a place I would take my family again too! Even down to my little niece (7 yrs old) enjoyed her food experience. Good job Harlem!!!!!  Happy Sunday!

I didn't know such a great place was right around City College! The food was super delicious and the service was amazing. The chef was very nice and attentive to what we did and didn't like. The mimosa was a bit strong for me personally, and they offered to remake it and take it off the bill!! 10/10 experience and would definitely recommend! Bonus is you get a 10% discount if you're a City College student and it's great little spot to get some cute pictures.

Friday morning around 9:30am, was greeted well by workers and the owner. Was welcomed to seat anywhere I pleased. The waiter came and took my order quickly, food was done to perfection and brought to me in a timely manner. I was actually surprised.... I ordered the shrimp n grits platter included: two eggs, your choice of a second poultry and freshly squeezed orange juice. Those were my choices they had other options available such as: turkey bacon, sausage and etc for poultry & for drinks: tea, mimosa and others. Great place, I will be back. Thanks Home Sweet Harlem for making my morning lol

Small portions, probably because they forgot a main part of the dish. Did the shrimp, eggs, and grits omelette and they forgot the grits. I also got a side of turkey sausage that was undercooked. Luckily I could pick out the potatoes that were cooked into the omelette so I didn't go without eating. $25 for potatoes.
Forgot my juice. Didn't call me. Biscuits were terrible. Grits overly smothered in butter, like can I get grits with my butter?? No stars.

I wanted to give this 2 stars but the cook was extremely polite and came out to greet us. Let's get to the food. What we ordered:Elote: not real elote. It was grilled corn but didn't taste fresh. The chipotle mayo was off and so was the cheese. It didn't taste authentic. Turkey sandwich: very simple and basic. It was good for what it was.Creole: tasty-ish it had good flavor but wasn't too hotMac n cheese: stale and a little burntWe ordered a few other entrees but none stood out as memorable or anything I'd re-order

As a Yelper, I am not a food critic but rather an experience critic. The experience I had a Sweet Home Harlem was definitely on-point. I think I really enjoyed this place also due to the hospitality of our server, William. When we walked in, our server made us feel right at home. He gave us the low-down on what was good on the menu and was just a ball of good vibes. He made sure our mimosa glasses never went dry and recommended some dope places to visit while in Harlem. The food was about 4-stars to be quite honest. It was good but not mind-blowing. It all tasted very fresh and came out hot. I liked my farm skillet and my guest really enjoyed their shrimp/fish and grits. Everything was seasoned well. The cook/owner even came out to say hello to our table. I think the prices were fair. I didn't like that they only took cash (I think the machine was down) but they took off the fee to use the ATM next door which was nice.The restaurant itself was a real cozy spot as well. It feels like it once was a coffee shop or something. I'd come here to get some work done or for a family brunch. They also played R&B music while we ate which definitely set a good vibe as well. Like I stated before, the experience was just great especially with our server William. I definitely recommend.

Food was popppiinnn.. Server was kinda stank. I did have a complicated order but it didn't need to set the tone for our service. Minus that, everything that came out of the kitchen looked so good and the food we had taste good as well.

My order never arrived, although I had given specific instructions. No other delivery service has had any difficulty getting my food delivered. I'm a nurse from out of state, having to get delivery food & also helping local businesses. It was a shame!

Customer service: Upon entering the establishment, the welcome and energy from the waitress was uninspiring.Food: They did not have fresh orange juice as advertised, and paid full price for some Tropicana orange juice. Pancake batter was bland, and the French toast was overcooked. The turkey sausage had a strange taste and texture. The salmon croquettes were okay.

Amazing breakfast and even better people! Would highly recommend this place if you're in the area. Friendly, great service, as well as great food.I got the eggs, turkey bacon and challah French toast, which was delicious! The eggs come with cheese as well, which I would recommend (get it light, though).Overall, great spot! Can't go wrong with amazing food and great people!

The food was delicious! I had the shrimp and grits with a salmon cake. From the first bite I was hooked. Everything was so flavorful. The wait staff was amazing. Our server Jennifer was attentive and made the whole brunch experience even more special. All of the Home Sweet Harlem staff were friendly. I will definitely be back, and next time with more people.

I was looking for brunch recommendations about 3 weeks ago and Home Sweet Harlem was suggested by a friend. After looking at the menu and website I decided I didn't want to go that day but would put a pin in it to return later. The same week, the restaurant came up in conversation (with others) on several occasions, so I thought, "I have to give this place a try." ...I should have stuck with my first mind. I went for brunch today and it was awful. Upon walking in I was not greeted by anyone at all. I walked over to an extremely cluttered bar (unsure if it was available for seating) in search of direction, seat assignment, service...SOMETHING. I ask if I had to sit at a table of if I could sit at the bar. I was told the bar was ok, things were moved to create some kind of space for me, and I was given a menu. The menu wasn't easy to follow but I figured it out after speaking with the bartender. I ordered the Home Skillet with yams + Unlimited Drinks for one hour (which is a little overpriced considering the quality) and waited. 5 minutes later the lights at the bar turn off because water is leaking from the light bulbs. None of the staff seem to really care... 5 minutes after that a gentleman walks up to the bar to tell the bartender/server that he's leaving because he has yet to receive his food. The server seems marginally surprised but not very apologetic. 5 more minutes later a young lady walks in and sits next to me, orders her food and ends up receiving her entree before I receive mine. I don't say anything but the server immediately realizes this is an issue as I have been waiting a while at this point. Another man, who I assume is the manager, walks up to apologize about the wait time and explains that tickets are being lost in the kitchen but my food will be out shortly. I calmly ask if there will be any accommodation for my inconvenience. He hesitates then tells me that "the took the gratuity off my bill," as if that's some kind of favor for the terrible service I'm receiving. Eventually my meal comes. It's fine. There were a lot of shrimp in the Home Skillet, which I appreciated. The yams were a little burnt but I liked the flavor. Overall the meal was decent. I have no desire to go back to Home Sweet Harlem. The laissez-faire attitude of the entire staff about the terrible service they provided was more off putting than my average entree. Clean it up, guys. Seriously. I don't know if I just got a bad day or if this is consistent service but I would have loved to experience the place that was recommended to me in the onset. #outtoeatwithJB

Review is based on a Sunday brunch and reg breakfast menu. Nice spacious locations and art work on the wall. Waitress was very nice, and mildly attentive, not so much her fault, as she was the only one aside from the owner. I ordered the farmers skillet and was not impressed...with all of the combined ingredients, it still lacked flavor. The turkey bacon was good. My grits were delicious and creamy. I also had a Bellini, had to remind the waitress twice, the drink  was just ok. I also had peppermint tea which was good.My husband ordered the shrimp n grits and didn't care for it.  He also ordered two sunny-side eggs and they somehow came with their shells crumbled in smh.  He didn't like that his grits were layered with a sauce, tomato and onions. He did not complete his meal. He thought the mimosa was ok, and did enjoy the fresh OJ. My dad has griddle cakes and strangely did not enjoy them. He left most of them on his plate. I believe he stated they were very dry. He wasn't a fan of the house coffee but he drank it.This is a spot that you can try at least once, hopefully they will make improvements to their food.

I recently had brunch here and the owner Donna is absolutely amazing, her staff is super sweet and the food was DELICIOUS!I don't eat pork and so enjoying places for breakfast or brunch, sometimes my options are severely limited but her sausage is all a tasty turkey sausage (the bacon too), and the shrimp and grits is TO DIE FOR!I also like to indulge in alcoholic beverages with my brunch and their add on for an hour of bellinis, mimosas, sangria and etc was perfect and at a great price point. This is now one of my favorite places to eat in a beautiful part of Harlem.

This was absolutely DISGUSTING. My sister wanted to come here for a while. I had a bad gut feeling about this place just from passing it a few times. I decided to just go with it and we went for breakfast this Saturday. I am pregnant and was absolutely ravished ready to eat. As I was looking at the menu, nothing seemed appetizing at all and I had serious doubts about the food. I thought maybe I was just being negative. I was still skeptical but decided to play it safe and order the "grilled cheese" which was described as being made on toasted sourdough bread with 3 kinds of cheeses. I asked if the grilled cheese cake with anything and the waitress seemed unsure she said she thought it came with a plain garden salad. I also asked for some home fries but was told they just have regular potatoes. Okay. My sister ordered one of the large breakfast plates with frittata and asked for a cappuccino. The waitress asked what a cappuccino was and said they didn't have that, then quickly switched and said they do have it. It took about 40 minutes for the food to come. When it arrived, I was very confused as to what I was looking at. The grilled cheese was on a very lightly toasted sandwich bread resembling wonder bread that was NOT sourdough. Strangely enough, it contained NO cheese. Imagine a grilled cheese with no cheese. The barely toasted bread was then filled with a slew of unidentified ingredients. There was some sweet potato, greens, and something sour. There was no salad to be seen. The potatoes were hard, undercooked, and not seasoned at all. My sister opened the cup of her "cappuccino" and it has about one ounce of liquid in a huge cup. She didn't know what it was supposed to be. Also, no utensils or napkins were brought and i had to ask for them. We politely tried to start eating the food. Neither of us could mask our disgust. She then asked for a regular coffee with cream and sugar instead. It was even worse and she could not drink more than one sip. We did not finish our food. I had a strange taste in my mouth that caused my throat to feel itchy and gross. My sister said her stomach was hurting. We did not finish the food. I would have complained, but I could tell they were a lost cause. I didn't want anything else from them. Should have complained and got my money back because I was furious paying for this absolutely disgusting meal. Paying for a grilled cheese that was neither grilled nor contained a shred of cheese or cake with anything on the side!! I saw two different parties come and leave without ordering whole I was there. That should have been me. We paid, and left to another spot as we were still starving and needed to wash down the taste of that crime against humanity. The rest of the day, my sister had "bubble guts" and was complaining of pain in her stomach just from a few bites of their dog grub. Don't ever subject yourself to this nastiness!!! And it is extremely overpriced. You could eat an expired yogurt out of your fridge at home and be more satisfied. Would give no stars if i could. Sickening!!

Although the hospitality is great here, the food was not. I was really expecting a great meal after this spot was recommended on so many sites. We brought a group of friends here and it was a little embarrassing that the food wasn't as good as it was hyped up to be.  Sadly we won't be returning.

I have been to this small attractive restaurant severaltimes. On Friday I went back and was not disappointed. The food was as amazing as before and the staff as friendly. The owner was there and greeted me warmly d made me feel welcome. The home skillet was delicious and the roasted  were yams excellent.  I have several go to breakfast places in Harlem and this is definitely one of the best. I will continue to return

I've only been here for brunch and for good reason - my boyfriend and I go a lot and bring friends here too. The selling point for us is the 1-hour of unlimited mimosas for $20. And they do an EXCELLENT job of making sure your glass is never low or empty. Even when the restaurant is packed, we still got excellent service.My favorite thing to order is anything with the grits. Overall, this is a fun, neighborhood place to get good brunch and mimosas!

If time is indeed money than this place owes us money.Waiting 10 mins for the waiter and another 15 mins to get our breakfast/brunch is totally not acceptable. And hearing a bunch of waiter keep apologizing to every customer for the long wait doesn't make it better... even worse, because instead of going back to work they are standing there and apologizing which makes us wait even longer. I'm not saying it was bad, because the service was still friendly.The brunch is $12 for simply eggs and bread and that kind of things. And if you add a little you can get the $20 menu including a drink. I think both is not cheap and will still make you leaving this place with an empty stomach.Overall it's a nice, cozy place with friendly service and decent food. But the long wait and high price won't get me back.

I give this a place 3 stars for the food. The restaurant serves great food. I had a frittata made with shrimp and onions. I also had their bottomless mimosas. The oj pulp was too big which didn't make the drink enjoyable. The price was too high for what you get. However, I would be willing to try the place out again because of the food so long as the brunch prices were reduced.
Super homey space, wonderful sweet servers and food so good you'll need to roll yourself out! This is exactly the kind of local, down-home spot you want in your neighborhood! It is our new go-to!

Let me say that I felt like I was at a family reunion and the waiter was my cousin and the chef was my aunt lol. That's how great the service was! Very homely feeling just very inviting. I had the pleasure of having William as my waiter. He was hilarious lol. We vibed so well the entire time there was nothing but jokes and great conversations. He was very fast and accurate with service and let us substitute drinks we wished to have. He's such a gem to the establishment. I even was able to meet the cook and she was just as sweet. She provided information for other days to come and new items she's going to add to the menu. I truly thank you Guys. Now how could I forget the food. It was soooo good. Some good healthy but soul food at the same time. Seasoned perfectly! Each dish includes turkey bacon, turkey sausage, or salmon cake. Along with one drink and coffee now who includes all that together AMAZING!! There's a bottomless option as well. I honestly can't wait to come back!!

I finally got there! Sad to report I didn't have a good time. My drink, my main focus, pineapple ginger, mint was just so-so. It just wasn't properly blended all the ginger and mint pieces stayed on top of the ice cubes, in the drink was just pineapple juice. Only a breakfast menu was available even though it was already 12 noon. There's more but I need not go on. We got our two drinks, paid our bill and left. Pout, I really wanted to love the place. 2 stars for Service. He was very apologetic that they were not ready to serve lunch.

Sunday morning our group of eleven was looking for an early start before heading to a Yankee game. This place fit the bill and was very comfortable. The staff was accommodating and patient with our large group. Facts: bottomless mimosas go for one hour but since this is a mom and pop shop we drank through all 6 of their bottles... Would be a perfect spot for a couple of ppl looking for a casual, low key, no pressure and local spot.

Went here based on yelp. Place was empty when I got there. Was given water with no ice. Waitress seemed annoyed to be at work. When inquiring about specials of the day as it specifies to do on their menu the waitress simply said "no". When I inquired about whether the sandwiches came with anything again simply "no". I wasn't told they had no lemonade until I inquired about it was after ordered and waiting for food to arrive. The sandwich wasn't bad but it was nothing special and didn't even have all the ingredients listed. I didn't inquire as I assumed all I'd get was were out of it since I wasn't informed I wouldn't get what I ordered when I ordered it. Maybe brunch is better but doubt I'll give them another shot after today's poor showing. For the record the guy waiting on everyone else seemed pleasant with those guests and the lady at the register before my shitty waitress came scowling over was pleasant. They also have a tipping included policy which I assume accounts for the waitresses poor attitude

Anything but Home Sweet Home. I wish I could give this place zero stars. I went there on a Saturday afternoon with my husband.  First at the door no one was there to greet us, we had to call out for someone who kept walking back and forth and not acknowledging us. Once inside we were told to sit where ever, so we did. It took several minutes to receive a glass of water. There were several employees just walking around and not assisting. Then a group of 4 came in after us and were immediately tended to. Their orders were taken and we still waited another 3 mins before walking out. Over 20 mins and no service is unacceptable and I would never return there or recommend this place to anyone.

Nice relaxed placed by CCNY. Fresh food made to order. I had the shrimp and grits with scrambled eggs and toast. Delicious... Took home half my food ate it hours later and it was still delicious... I love breakfast and they serve breakfast all day in addition to lunch and dinner. My co-worker had the the shrimp creole and cleaned her plate. Another co-worker had the salmon cakes, she didn't even share because they were so good. Healthy soulful cooking. Music in the bathroom is a plus  We will definitely return.

Came here for brunch and had a great meal.  #simple done well.Everyone pretty much got the farmer's skillet.  The frittata is made pretty well.  Grits were very rich and buttery.  Biscuits however were dry :( My favorite was the side of chicken cutlet which was a super juicy and crispy chicken breast--def supplement your dish with this.Overall: 3 bumped to 4 for the chicken cutlet and the friendly service and owner which I almost failed to mention.

Small but cozy. Our food was really good! Everything came out piping hot. They definitely are a small mom and pop shop so if you're not into the kind of spot where you order and someone in the back cooks it from scratch then don't bother. The attention to detail could be better - we had to ask for the fruit that was supposed to come with our meals, and we had to keep reminding the waitstaff to bring syrup, coffee, etc. Overall, we had a really good experience and plan to return.

As we entered Home Sweet Harlem we noticed (via a sign) that they were a cash only establishment for the time being due to technological issues, which was not a problem and I went to the corner store at the end of block to retrieve money. Upon returning our experience went downhill from there. My husband was interested in looking at the brunch menu, as many of the reviews have raved about their options and we were wondering if we could get a couple of the items. As soon as he picked up the menu to look at it, Jennifer, our waitress immediately says "You can't just pick stuff up without asking" muttered under her breath, but loud enough for me to hear her. It is a common practice for patrons to take a look at a menu while they are waiting to be seated, and mind you it was not busy and were not running out of menus. He returned the menu to its stand.As we were being seated I noticed that Jennifer was wearing a sheer skin tight black dress in which her areolas were completely visible. I do not have a problem with waitresses not wearing a bra or being able to see their nipples through the material, but being able to see your complete areolas through your dress is not appropriate for a "family friendly" restaurant. On top of her distracting apparel her attitude left much to be desired. She was rude, and could not or did not want to answer our simple question about the ingredients in one of the dishes. Aside being related to the owner I have no idea how she managed to get a job with her horrid attitude.Our food was decent, but both dishes ordered were missing turkey bacon, we ate it anyways because we did not want to  offend the hostile waitress once more. At the end of the meal we asked if they were out of turkey bacon (a logical conclusion) and she swore up and down it was in deed sprinkled on top of both our dishes. This was not true. My potatoes were either a day old and had been reheated, or had been sitting under the heat lamp for entirely too long as some pieces were really tough. From the time we ordered our food to the time it was delivered to our table it was  about 30-35 min and it took 15 min to get our check. Even then we still had to walk the check up to the bar instead of being taken care of at our table. It was clear that they only had one cook in the back and only two waitresses working that day, an inappropriate amount of servers and cooks for a day. As we walked the check up, the lady (different from our waitress) who was behind the bar making coffee and other assorted drinks was apparently on her break and taking a personal phone call in front of customers rather than going to the back or outside. She refused to acknowledge our presence and we had to wait for our rude waitress to come and close out the bill. A little bit of decency and politeness would have gone a long way to ensure that we would come back again. I understand that waitressing can be hard especially when you are one of two on the floor, but your attitude is what ensures customers have a good experience regardless of what else may be going on. FYI gratuity is included on the bill, and this may be why the service is so piss poor at this establishment.I really wanted to like this place and I am so disappointed.

Fantastic meal, terrific service.I had the Home skillet and my partner had the Farmer's Skillet. I can't wait to try everything. The frittatas were delicious as were the grits!I just moved to the neighborhood and will be back often.It's corny but the Donna (the chef) and William (the server) made me feel right at Home!

We decided to have brunch at HSH. We initially wanted to get some French toast but we're swayed by Yelp to get the shrimp and grits. We also opted for the unlimited bellini/mimosa/mechilada for one hour. It seemed like a good deal (additional $10 with a main entree). The bellini and mechilada were good. The mechilada wasn't quite like what I know it to be (nothing on the rim, less limey) but it wasn't bad. Service for us was a little spotty at first and then Daisy took over. She was amazing. Due to a snafu of some sort (us? waitress?) fish and grits came out instead of shrimp. We were ok with it but Daisy insisted that they at least correct one. Not never but appreciated. The food was good. Eggs were nicely seasoned, the grits came with plenty of butter, and the fish was good. The salmon cakes were good too (although my companion didn't like them as much)..  More for me! We will be back.

I came here in 2018 when I first moved to Harlem. The hostess/staff sat us down but never returned. We waited 15mins and just finally put our coats on and left. It's now Feb 2020 so I decided to give them another try. It was such a waste of time and money. When we arrived there was only one other couple in the restaurant but somehow the service was super slow.Cons:1. The restaurant didn't have any champagne so we weren't able to order mimosas2. Our sangria's came out 15 mins after we received our food although we ordered the drinks way before we gave her our food order.3. I asked the waitress for additional napkins 3 times as I had spilled syrup and she still never brought it over.4. Service was extremely slow although the restaurant was empty.Pros:1. The restaurant itself was cozy and cute although it needs a deep clean.2. Only a short 10min walk from my house.To sum everything up unfortunately I will not return.

I had brunch here on my birthday (a Tuesday at 12pm) with a total of 4 people and overall it was a great experience. I chose this place because I go to school nearby and I had class later that day lol. I did not make a reservation because it was a weekday and i figured it would be a quick brunch. When I arrived, I was told there was no brunch option (with champagne), so my party was about to leave and go to a nearby restaurant that offers champagne brunch on weekdays. As we were walking out, the owner actually stopped us and told us that we can do the champagne brunch. It turns out that Mother's Day was a huge business day for them (of course) and they pretty much had very limited options as far as the menu goes. They went above and beyond to please us given the limited menu and that deserves 5 stars. I had the farmer's omelet with catfish, grits, and toast. It was delicious! It sounds like a weird combination but the waitress recommended it and it was great. My friends loved their food as well. We had unlimited mimosas for 1 hour (kind of a bummer but better than nothing). The service was great and the food is all organic btw.  I would definitely go back.

I rallied up my coworkers for a birthday brunch based on the great reviews of this place. We were a party of 12 and I made reservations with William; he was super helpful. The day of, we were seated pretty quickly and William made sure that we were all very well accommodated. There were a few off moments like since we were a big party it took a while to get our drinks and we were told that there's one chef in the kitchen. However, our food case out pretty quickly and everyone enjoyed it. I truly liked they start the hour of bottomless mimosas when the last person gets their drink. If I'm in area I'll come back.

Went here with a friend for Sunday brunch. The restaurant was pretty empty, but it had a great vibe: a lot of natural light, excellent decor (old pictures of all over Harlem and NYC), friendly and attentive waitstaff.They have two tiers of brunch items: $15 gets you a basic meal, $23 dollars gets you the meal, a choice between turkey bacon/turkey sausage/salmon cake, a choice of alcoholic beverage (the mimosas are excellent), and a coffee/tea. Certainly worth the extra $8, especially considering they ask you not to tip.I had the fish and grits. The grits were incredible - I would put them up against any grits I've had in the south. The fish (fried cod, I believe) was very good as well. The dish also came with 2 eggs and a mini salad, both of which were perfectly fine. My friend had the frittata with spinach, peppers, onions, and Swiss cheese with a side of yams and salad. She got the salmon cake and raved about it as well.Overall, this place is a gem. Great price for brunch, and a great way to start a perfect New York City day.

I was greeted with "Hello" like I owed the woman money. Fine. I'll take that. I said it's just me I was given a paper menu and told to sit at any two top. There was a table of four already there. No one else. I sat myself and she brings water and says "Just to let you know it's cash only". I give her a look and she says there's an atm at the bodega next door. Then she goes over to the table of four and tells them it's cash only. They all look at each other like " oh no! I have no cash". I left. This was a one star experience.

I was greeted with "Hello" like I owed the woman money. Fine. I'll take that. I said it's just me I was given a paper menu and told to sit an any two top. There was a table of four already there. No one else. I sat myself and she brings water and says "Just to let you know it's cash only". I give her a look and she says there is an atm at the bodega next door. Then she goes over to the table of four and tells them it's cash only. They all look at each other like " oh no! I have no cash". I left. This was a one star experience.

This is a cozy, sunny spot for brunch! I had the Farmer's Skillet, which was so full and flavorful of sausage, potatoes, peppers, and onions. The roasted potatoes on the side were delicious. Also had the Fish and Grits, which was the best on the menu! The grits are real, so they were creamy and had the perfect bite. The fish was flaky, moist, and well-seasoned. The Salmon Cakes didn't stand out too much. Definitely would like to come back for the griddle cakes next time!

This place was a great choice! My friend Melissa and I stopped by for brunch before looking at apartments to buy. It was rainy and cold out so it was pretty empty. The menu was pretty straightforward they had a $14 option and $20 platter option which included fresh orange juice or mimosas. We chose the latter. I ordered a turkey and cheddar omelette with turkey sausage and grits, it came with a biscuit and a small side salad. It was very tasty. My friend ordered the spinach, onion and garlic frittata with potatoes and turkey bacon. Our server was cool and we spoke to the manager/owner on the way out. It was a nice spot to go to in Harlem with good food. I recommend.

My friends and I went to Harlem to see Hamilton's house and I found this place on Yelp. It's in walking distance so it was perfect. They were serving brunch. I ordered the cremini mushroom omelette with grits. So delicious!! We all enjoyed the food. The atmosphere was amazing and we ended up taking to the owner, Donna, for awhile after. We had an amazing experience. Highly recommend for the food and the atmosphere (plus Mimosas!). What more do you need?? Five stars!

This place has easily become one of my favorite brunch spots. When my friends visit from outside the city, I always try to bring them here. I came in last Sunday and had another great experience. The place wasn't overcrowded and the music playlist was perfect for a Sunday morning in Harlem. My friend and I chose the unlimited drinks option and our waitress kept the peach bellinis flowing. I wish I remembered her name but her nails were super cute lol.  I ordered the shrimp and grits (which, I'm serious, will make you say AMEN). After trying a few other items on the menu during previous visits, my girlfriends and I agree that the savory items are more flavorful and are a better deal than the sweet breakfast foods. Overall, the service and food was amazing! I'll definitely be back soon!

This was my first time at Home Sweet Harlem. On a Sunday morning, I joined my cousin and her friends who were in from out of town. I actually recommended this place to my cousin based on the reviews from Yelp. It is located off of 135th and Amsterdam in West Harlem. Upon entering to the left, there is a nice sized dining room full of two-tops and four tops, both square and round. There is also a bar area to your right when you enter. William, with family from Marietta, was our server who was an absolute delight. He definitely added to our experience. Based off of William's recommendations, I ended up ordering the $23 option of the home skillet dish with shrimp which came with a coffee and a drink - I optioned for the mango bellini.  The coffee was really good too. Every establishment does not have a nice blend but I appreciated this particular cup. And they have Truvia to sweeten. Honestly everything was good. I asked that my frittata be on the softer side after I ordered and William relayed the message and made it happen. Everything was excellent. I needed no salt or pepper. Everything was flavored and seasoned to perfection. I don't like heavy food  or heavily seasoned food and my entire plate was well balanced. Like I said, I had the skillet which comes frittata style with shrimp and I elected for a salmon cake for my breakfast meat and it came with cheese grits and a biscuit. Again, everything was excellent. I cleaned my plate with pleasure. Service was prompt and polite. The food came in a timely manner.  We didn't have to wait for a table and it was always at a comfortable level in terms of noise and crowd size. I would highly recommend it. The quality was there and so was the value.I will be back!
