A group of us friends were visiting NYC and decided to try this place out. Glad we did.  I have the shrimp and grits- delish!!My son had the meatballs- delish!!  They happened to make some biscuits while we were there (the owner told us they only make them on holidays). They were amazing. Very nice people work here. My only suggestion would be that the servers get a bit more training. It seemed like they weren't familiar with the menu and what can or can't be substituted.  So if you're in the area and want fresh tasting soul food, stop in.
Food is ok not great, but the service is terrible. The staff is nice but they just cant seem to get it together.  Avoid the pancakes at all cost.

Nice owner, but the food is mediocre. I really, really wanted to like this place. The shrimp and grits were bland, and the service was slow. The owner claimed that the chef was from Texas, but the food tasted otherwise. I am writing this review solely based on the fact that the hype is too real.

We are from Portland so we have a lot of little spot just like this . So it was nice to find something to give us a feeling of home from so far away .It was the hospitality that we experienced here that made it great. The owner was so nice and welcoming and even talked with us for a bit since we were  traveling and gave us some ideas on where to go and what to do.The food was good. Not amazing but it was good! It filled our bellies and make us happy. I got the breakfast burrito and it was yummy ! Everything tasted fresh And my husband got thE pancakes which were the winner here , they tasted like home .... Pancakes your mom makes for you early on a Sunday morning .It's too bad we won't be here for Sunday brunch to try the biscuits. We will just have to come back to NYC .

Went here this morning with a friend. I liked the casual vibe because we wanted to eat and talk. So, for us the service wasn't too slow. The staff was very friendly and seemed to take pride in the place, which is a plus.  The food was good - attractive, home made style. I appreciated the juicy, turkey sausage and griddle cakes with yogurt and bananas. My scrambled eggs had a little cheese in them which I didn't expect but really enjoyed. My companion also enjoyed her griddle cakes and turkey bacon. Ohh, also liked the touch of warm milk to go with my coffee. All in all, we had a relaxing, delicious afternoon. I recommend it and hope to go there again.
Delicious food. Only downfall was that the waitress forgot to put our order in and we spent at least an hour waiting for our food

Shrimp and grits were way too good. Borderline problematic because I could see myself coming here more than I should. Super friendly staff, welcoming atmosphere. And most importantly the food was amazing.

Dropped in for brunch at Home Sweet Harlem. The place was fairly empty, but it was a weekday morning. The menu had about less than a dozen dishes. I ordered a hot cider and the mimosa and shrimp/fish and grits combo. The shrimp/fish and grits had about 4 pieces of shrimp and 2 pieces of fried crusted white fish topped with a salsa garnish. The shrimp and fish and grits were amazing. The grits were creamy  and fluffy with nice subtle flavors and the mixture of both the shrimp and fried fish in the dish came together nicely. A nice little spot in Harlem for a bite and drink. After eating a shrimp and grits meal a few days before from a popular place that missed the mark, the dish here reminded me why I like shrimp and grits so much. The service was friendly and attentive.

My new favorite local hang. Food is quite good (the roasted potatoes are actually roasted), prices are great, portions substantial. Friendly, spacious atmosphere with a variety of tables (I like the high ones). The service is on the slow side, but everything feels so genuine, a pleasant contrast to the micromanaged, polished, fast pace of the rest of the city. A true, legit "mom and pop" that has somehow found elegance while escaping the several cycles of ultra-refinement most NYC cafes go through. If I were ever to open a restaurant, this would be what it looks and feels and tastes and sounds like, complete with the local art and live jazz. I stumbled in two weeks ago, and already I'm practically part of the scenery.

I saw this place on yelp and thought to give it a try since they have pretty good reviews. My friend and I was in the restaurant waited for 10mins to get seated when there was couple of tables open. Didn't take long to place my order considering the limited selection for brunch. However, took forever to get our food and they didn't even have salt/pepper or condiment ready set on the table. We had to ask for them as well as a silverware set. Really?!? Our drinks was sitting at the bar for awhile. Not all of my food came out together. The food was okay. Presentation was not all that! AND I HAD EGG SHELLS IN MY FRITATA.... Would not recommend anyone to go there, unless you have a lot of time to do nothing..you can waste you time there. It's pricy for not that much food!!
GREAT Food and Service!! Home Sweet Harlem really makes you feel at Home! The Owner is Very Hands On with an Amazing/Professional Staff... I will be back
Great staff as well as food. However their food is Overpriced and the portion size is small.

I really like supporting black owned businesses, especially here in Harlem. I'd go back if they worked on the adjusting the prices or the serving sizes. $20 for brunch is okay if the plates are shareable or pretty large in size. They're not -- beware! You won't leave hungry but you won't leave happy either. Also, the service, while extremely friendly and warm, was a bit slow, if you're in a rush, better try another spot.

This place is a delight. I took an out of town friend here and the service, food and atmosphere were everything you'd want from a brunch place: simple, reliable and a good value. I hope they stick around.
Food was delicious we had the shrimp and grits and fish and grits, both were very flavorful. I took my mom for her birthday and we definitely want to try for dinner (more options)
Food was delicious we had the shrimp and grits and fish and grits, both was very flavorful. I took my mom for her birthday and we def want to try for dinner more of an option

Came in on a work day with my daughter for breakfast. We arrived just after opening, so we were the only ones in the restaurant. The wait staff was super friendly and very attentive. I wasn't sure if I wanted the Shrimp and Grits, or Fish and Grits. The owner/ Chef  came out and suggested that I try both. She created a special combination plate for me, and the food was great!

This is my favorite place for breakfast. Never been for any other meals besides breakfast but their menu for lunch and dinner also look great. Reminds me of the good local places you find in New Orleans. Food is good stick to your bones kind of home cooking. You get so much for your money here. Me and my wife always get the egg combos which come with a ton of food and side of griddle cakes for good measure.The biscuits and the sides (yams, grits, etc) are the icing on the cake of a great meal. The people who work here are so nice and always super accommodating to me and my wife even when we bring our 7 month son. I would eat here everyday if I could. Can't recommended it more. Every neighborhood in NYC should be so lucky to have a place like this.

The food, service, and atmosphere are amazing. We had a massive group come in and all of us were well taken care of. Home Sweet Harlem boasts home cooked food and they do not disappoint - their chicken and waffles, grits, mac and cheese, walnut apple salad, and plantains and guac were so so so good. Highly recommend and well worth the visit!

Nice to have a place like this in the neighborhood. I am brunching on a Saturday and was surprised how well the food is cooked. Brunch menu is small and simple, but it helps for making selections easy. Got a mozz sundried tomato omelet with turkey sausage and potatoes. Turkey sausage and potatoes had a slight crisp which was delightful. Omelette is tasty and well prepared. Includes a beverage (alcohol too) for $20. Of course I just settled for a mimosa. My server Yvens was very attentive and friendly, but not talkative which is what is preferred. Food presentation is lovely. Come here if you want a simple brunch without all the bells and whistles - elaborate brunch.
Loved this place. My fiance and I both got the challah french toast and it was divine!! Everyone there is extremely friendly. Definitely going back soon!!

Ughh I came here to celebrate my mother's birthday. I asked for shrimp and grits and they have shrimp. Come on you should have all ingredients in stock. We waited over 40 minutes to get our food. Our drinks didnt come right away either. Will never come here again.

We came here after the Percy Sutton race for brunch.  The food was very good and the proportions were adequate.  I had the farmers skillet with potatoes.  I highly recommend it, especially if you like sausage. Not too thrilled about the  the service.  We waited about 45 minutes for our food to come out, and within that time, the waiter only came to our table once to refill our drinks only because we got his attention.  It was somewhat busy that morning, but not all the tables were occupied.  Perhaps the service would be better on a less busy day.

Upon moving to New York from Tennessee, I gave up on finding a good biscuit in the North. It's like finding a good taco outside of California, it just doesn't happen. But low and behold, Home Sweet Harlem makes me forget the city streets, confusing subway maps and 24 hr bodegas.  For breakfast, I'm back home.

purchased the egg cheese & biscuit. I was shocked on how small it was for 12 dollars. Could have gone to corner store and got same thing for 2.50. It. Was nothing spectacular. My grits we're clumpy and cold.

I had breakfast here with a friend. We had the option of eating at the bar or being seated. We sat at a table in the lightly crowded dining area where a waiter greeted us immediately. They offer a simple and somewhat healthy menu. I had scrambled eggs, fried yams, and a fruit salad. The bananas in the salad was kind of mushy but everything else was great. Altogether It was a good food along with great service

Quaint/cozy atmosphere, slow service, average to decent food.After visiting a nearby coffee shop my family and I were on the hunt for some food. We saw that this place served brunch and decided to stay. When we first arrived there were only about 3 other seated groups/couples. The menus are on plain computer paper and a bit wrinkled which is OK, but there were different versions and at first it was confusing.I had the griddle cakes with a salmon cake on the side, my mother had grits, and my sister a fruit and cheese plate. My mother said the grits were really great, which says a lot because we're from New Orleans. My griddle cakes (flat pancakes) were OK. They weren't anything special. They were made with fennel seed which was not on the menu.The thing that got us was that after waiting for 15-20 minutes for our hot food, my baby sister had to wait an extra 10 minutes for a fruit and cheese plate. It required no cooking, but simply putting cheese and grapes on a plate. That was a disappointment. Additionally, the server never came to refill our water glasses, and I had to work really hard to get the check.

So...I have to say I believe in second chances.  Home Sweet Harlem is a great local spot and the proprietor Donna is so sweet and kind. I love her ideas behind getting the community together and supporting local artists and chefs. Donna has been so generous to let a local group of mothers, myself included get together and have a weekly story time in her fabulous space. The first week I tried the Caesar salad with organic chicken and it was honestly delicious!  Each week now I have enjoyed a large portion of Caesar salad with their yummy homemade dressing and croutons. Home sweet harlem is a great place to book large parties and events I definitely recommend working with Donna and the Caesar salad!!

This was a very disappointing encounter. My friend and I just ate here for an early dinner and it was terrible. We walked in to be greeted by a friendly server but no heat or music and a very empty restaurant. (Now I see why.).  The menus were on ratty pieces of computer paper and the edges were curling from general wear and tear and lack of lamination. We ordered our food. I ordered per our server's convincing recommendation of the turkey burger. To my dismay the burger came out tasteless and COLD.  COLD. It was disgusting. The best part of the burger was the sight of it and even the sight was questionable. I could have made a better turkey burger at home from scratch and I've never made one before. I was so hungry I ate a couple tasteless bites until I couldn't bare the cold burger anymore. I let our waiter know it came out cold. He did not offer to take it back or have it remade. He only offered a slice of sweet potato pie which I politely declined. The lack of service is speculative maybe due to no manager or just bad service. And no music was weird and intimidating. As someone who has worked in the food & beverage industry I know the first thing is to take the food back and take it off the check and THEN offer complimentary dessert. (That's what should have happened). As a local this regrettable 'find' was super disappointing because the venue itself is a gem. Despite the waiter's attempted swag I have to give my recent dining experience 2 thumbs way down. Don't waste your money.

Really enjoyed the food here. 20 dollars got me stuffed and semi boozy, can't beat that. Good mimosas and the challah french toast were my fav along with the fresh whipped cream. Griddle cakes were good too. Side of yams was necessary in my case and boy was I stuffed. Will definitely return. Also, Joanna our server was very attentive. I love supporting small businesses like this.
The frittata's are excellent and today the Rosemary potatoes were fragrant and tasty. Service attentive and friendly.

After a long run, I was in the mood for some grits. I was with my boyfriend and my coworker. We walked in and were seated immediately and since we were starving, we took one look at the menu and we all ordered the sausage, egg and biscuit. I also ordered a cappuccino and grits with cheese. The grits hit the spot for me and the coffee was really good, it definitely woke me right up. Service was slow but it was fine because my group was so busy talking and eating. I would go back after another long run :-)

SUCH AMAZING FOOD!!We are so happy to have this place in the neighborhood.Food is WAY better than The Grange, which is down the block and always has a wait. GO TO HOME SWEET HARLEM INSTEAD!! Support this place so they can stay in business forever!!Order the shrimp and grits, it has such wonderful flavors and a nice portion size.Service is very friendly. Can't recommend enough.
Love, love, love this spot. A work in progress as far as staffing goes, but the food is absolutely delicious! A true gem.
Simply perfection. Great staff, delicious food (especially the grits and frittata) & good environment. -The Southerner

Had a superfine turkey burger with bacon and cheese. Came with the best pickle I ever had, and on a gorgeous flaky roll. Hot, delicious coffee came with steamed milk, and the hot chocolate arrived especially rich, but not too sweet or heavy.  All this with friendly service (perhaps more attention than usual because the place was in between busier service hours)...a homegrown spot that's cozy the moment you walk in. Music kept me focused, not distracted, on my work. Even with their wifi. Seriously, this is mom 'n pop in Harlem. It's the way it should always and forever be.
Delicious. Had grits for the first time with an egg, shrimp and a spicy sauce. My friend had a fresh and tasty cobb salad. Want to go back and try everything else on the menu.

I am severely disappointed by my second experience here. I loved my first time so much I decided to take a group of six for Mother's Day. Everything possible that could go wrong with our order did. It was not crowded and yet the waiters were running around like their heads were chopped off and did not give us half of our food despite multiple requests for the items. The waiter kept saying it is on the way and then would not bring the items. I ordered the same thing as last time and it was not nearly as good. The waiter made no attempt to rectify the disaster and charged us full price despite the fact he did not bring us everything. Will not be going back.
Had a great experience! I had the challah French toast which was fluffy and delicious! Very friendly staff.

I came here with my friends for a quick brunch. The dishes menu were a bit pricey & the food was so bland &the portions were small. It was not worth it at all. On top of that, the waitress gave us the wrong check.

I had awhile without ordering turkey burgers anywhere because they are usually dry. The one I was served here was just perfect. The turkey burger and the corn on the cob were the best part of my meal. Buffalo wings were not spicy and I wasn't a fan at the blue cheese crumbles melted on it. Also had iced  coffee with almond milk, I was only provided with sugar packets which kind of sucks for iced coffee. Nice clean spot, I would not mind coming here again.

Food was Editable, food presentation wasn't great, customer service was slow, forgetful. On top of everything there were only five people dining at the time, don't understand why service was so bad. Waiters and waitress were more concerned with their conversations then their guests. The young busser was very attentive and refilled our water. He was great! That's the only reason for the one star.

Donna the owner is great and the breakfast that she made for me was just as great!! I walked to Home sweet Harlem from the edge of Hamilton Heights/Harlem and it was a fantastic walk. Highly recommend!!

Found a new favorite brunch spot in my hood! So excited I've been wanting to try this place for a while and it did not disappoint! I got the farmers skillet  and it was delicious! They gave a great amount of food and everything was so flavorful! I also really loved the old school down south decor! I will definitely be back!!!

Love Love LOVE this place! My favorite is the weekend brunch (I've never had a meal here any other time of day to actually compare) but the brunch is AWESOME. Really flavorful home cooked, warm your soul type food. Kind service. And it's Black Owned.

I came here for breakfast with my best friend on a Wednesday morning. Location is prime, right in  front of city college. Waiter was very friendly and cute. Space is pretty big but has character. We ordered a very traditional pancake, omelet and gritz.  They had run out of whip cream but after pouting a little, the waiter proceeded to whip the whip cream on the spot.  At the end the owner, Donna, came out and asked how we enjoyed it all. Even shared about her dreams with the place. I love supporting great spots so, if you're in the area looking for a casual but home spot.  Visit them and order some yummy food.

My girlfriends and I discovered Home Sweet Harlem online, while trying to find a kid-friendly brunch spot. We arrived on a Sunday afternoon, and were greeted by a warm and friendly staff. The place has a nice, and cozy feel of a cafe. The food is super fresh, and clean. The owner even came out towards the end of our meal, for some conversation. Overall, I enjoyed my experience, and will return.
Food was very good, especially the griddle and salmon cakes.

I really wanted to like this place (mom/pop shop, straightforward cooking, etc.), and after reading the previous reviews, I ventured past the familiar brunch spots on FDB to try this out. I'm not familiar with brunch spots north of here so maybe it's good for the neighborhood, but there are just much better options south of 135th St, like Maison Harlem, Harlem Tavern, Amy Ruth's, even Jimbo's. The bang for the buck just isn't there: $12 for a breakfast sandwich on a mini biscuit? They're $4 from the bodega and taste better. Biscuit was too dense, grits were clumpy, eggs were over cooked, and the potatoes were lukewarm. Service was friendly and personable, but not very present. I wish I lived closer so I could have another opportunity to see what the hype is about, but the food will not bring me back.

It looks cute and kind. I was feeling it would be great. However, I think the chef smoked a fatty and left his head at home. It took over an hour to make 2 burgers and no one was in the restaurant.  Then my food had wilted lettuce and a stale bun. My man's food some how was forgotten and took another 20minutes.  Plus the coffee taste burnt. Then they didn't even comp any of our food. Don't eat here.

Perfect for a chill Sunday brunch. $20 will get you griddle cakes, sausage, eggs, and a cocktail included. And bottomless coffee. Cute decor, friendly staff, not at all crowded. Definitely can't complain.
Fantastic food with great service...  If you are ever in the neighborhood...  Drop by for a quick bite...  You will go away happy!

Fabulous local eatery, great service great food and a cool calm environment equals amazingly deliciousness! I called and ahead while in my cab I arrived and was greeted by Donna herself (the owner) I have called ahead and so my amazing roasted sweet potatoes and biscuit sausage egg and cheese sandwich was waiting for me oh my God it was so great they even made a special chocolate latte for me!

I was very excited to go here and upon arrival I was surprised by the quick and polite service but after about 10 minutes that all changed. My service went from being slow to almost nonexistent, we had to try and get the attention of another waiter just to get our order.  We then ordered and they didn't bring out the correct sides to our breakfast and my french toast was so crunchy my knife had a hard time cutting it.  Overall, while the environment was nice and most the food seemed to be decent, for the price you could find somewhere more suitable for your brunch in the city!

I had the farmers skillet. It was tasty and didn't take much time to be served. The sweet potatoes on the side were delicious! The atmosphere is calm and relaxing during breakfast hours. Will come back for dinner. Inviting wait staff!

I had the farmers skillet. It was tasty and didn't take much time to be served. The sweet potatoes on the side were delicious! The atmosphere is calm and relaxing during breakfast hours. Will come back for dinner. Inviting wait staff!

I really wanted to give this place more stars but the service was TERRIBLE. Decided to try this place for Sunday brunch because most of the reviews were positive, boy was I wrong. I don't know if our server was high, tired or a mixture of both. He never came and checked on us, messed up our order and gave us the wrong information on what came with the meals. After sitting for about 30 mins after the meal another server came up and asks "did you order anything yet"? No I'm just sitting here for the view, of course I did!  This place really needs to get a grip on the service. The only thing that saved this place was the food. The scrambled egg on a croissant role was delicious. I want to give at least three stars but the service was that bad!

Went here for brunch twice with friends and it was a great experience! The food was very tasty, the service prompt and friendly and the prices were reasonable. The first time we had a nice chat with the owner and staff and ended up staying for another 20 minutes, talking about food, service the and the neighborhood. Felt right at home!

Went to Home Sweet Harlem in NY city yesterday for lunch on my way back to Boston. This new place was great!! The turkey burger I had was one of the best. The Caesar salad was fresh and crunchy, the dressing had a great zing. Check it out when your in up-town NY. Cheers, Bill from Boston

Found this place on Yelp when looking for somewhere to work and have a bit to eat while visiting from California. This place is a find. Great food. Great service! and WIFI! The coffee is really really good! The food was really really good. It is well made and focused on good healthy ingredients. It reminded me of a cafe you would find in California.

Phenomenal! The best breakfast I've had in months. I had the farmer's breakfast - buttery biscuit, warm sweet baked yams, savory egg scramble. Great service, clean and comfortable atmosphere. The only that would make me happier if this place was in my hometown.

Came here with friends for a happy hour and had a great time.  The fish tacos are delicious! Grilled basa with good seasoning and a nice sauce. Wine was $5 and bartender Gabe generous portions. The place is known for good soups and turkey burgers so I'll be back!

Love this place! We went out for a late breakfast and were not disappointed! Donna (I believe she is the owner) accommodated us with the breakfast menu even though it was past the usual breakfast time and recommended the shrimp skillet--yum! The yams were also delicious. My husband had the farmers skillet with grits --also a winner! We plan to go back and visit whenever we are in town. Highly recommend!

My wife and I just were crying there are no great brunch spots in The Bronx. Well go 2 stops on the D over to 145th in Harlem and there are a few - not UWS type options, but this place is as good as anything in the Upper west side. Wow. So damn good. And the service was exceptional. Great kid waited on us this morning - more on that in a bit. But so good and it fits the grit of harlem and the trendiness of the City College area. So the food - really good stuff. I ordered the baked French toast with scrambled eggs and turkey bacon, wife had the frittata, coffee, OJ. The French toast-  ordered with bananas and whipped cream. Server told me right after order was placed they were out of bananas and would any other fruit be okay, I said strawberries would be fine. Well when order showed up - bananas on top - said owner went out and got some. Only in NYC! Well the French toast was divine, good flavor. Scrambled eggs- I'm weird about eggs, like no brown at all. They had just a teeney tiney touch, and went ahead and tried them- so moist, so flavorful. Seasoned well with S&P, and scrambled really well. So yummy. Turkey bacon when it came out on plate you could see the shiny oily part to it, meaning it was freshly cooked. My wife's frittata - real good, the turkey sausage in it, was so moist and had that perfect sausage flavor to it. Just sweet and spicy enough. She doesn't eat flour so I took her biscuit , oh wow. Cheddar cheese in it, and really good. Highly recommend the biscuits, I ordered 2 extra, no kidding. And the OJ was freshly squeezed. And the coffee too - not sure what it was, but very good. Service - kid who waited on us you could tell was either newish or just learning to be a server maybe? But he was so damned polite, professional, and courteous. He got me extra syrup, 3 extra cups of coffee, the biscuits I ordered, joked with my wife and I, was on top of it. Asked about dinner - talked about the burgers and the turkey burgers. Such a nice guy. Met owner on way out - she talked to us for a while. Had a great attitude, talked biscuits and such. About 15 others came in to brunch while we were there, so very hopeful the place gets going and does great. It's a wonderful addition to that hood. Good luck Donna ( owner we met ) hope it makes it and we'll be back!

This place has really good food. The venue itself is a little shabby, but the food and service make up for it. We ordered the farmer's skillet and the fruit and cheese plate and a few drinks, and everything was really well prepared. The waitress was also nice!

Adorable place with lots of light. The espresso is solid, but the fresh biscuits were the winner. They were fluffy but not crumbly and buttery in all the right ways. It's a grand place to do work (fast wifi) without being bothered by waiters trying to flip your table. The staff is friendly and casual, just as they should be.

I'm not sure what happened to those that weren't happy but this place is simply OUTSTANDING. Very warm, well designed place and friendly staff (seems to be common with other reviews), and any previous negative comments about the food is perplexing as the food was DELICIOUS!  The staff even welcomed our requests to make our sandwiches with special changes.  Service was timely as well, so again, not sure of previous experiences but ours was simply exceptional. I guess staff can vary but it's hard to believe with the obvious pride that the owner places in this wonderful restaurant and the over-the-top warmth we found from the staff we met during our visit. Great to find healthy organic food along our travel route!  Give it a shot - good bet you'll be very happy you did!

This place is wonderful! I have been twice now, once for brunch and once for dinner. My sister and I live super close by and we were really excited when it opened up. The best thing about this place is the absolutely delicious food. At brunch my sister got the Farmhouse breakfast and I got the griddle cakes. My sister's meal came with delicious turkey sausage, toast, roasted potatoes and a frittata. Totally devoured.Their griddlecakes were the best I have in as long as I can remember - thinner than most pancakes and really flavorful, served with whipped cream and fresh fruit. We returned a week later with our other sister for dinner and were not disappointed. They graciously extended happy hour for us and we got two for one pitchers of sangria. We ordered a LOT of food and ate every bite. One of my sisters had a soup and the Riverside burger which had really delicious spicy mayo. Other sister and I split a harvest salad and a grilled cheese, which made a perfect meal. The salad had all my favorite goodies and they were happy to customize (I switched blue cheese for goat cheese and added beets). Everything in the salad was ultra fresh and the house made balsamic dressing was wonderful. Other positives: food is healthy with lots of fresh and organic ingredients, super friendly and warm staff, WiFi, and prices

Went here for breakfast while I was visiting NY and it was really good. The French toast was delicious, especially with whipped cream. I also got potatoes and eggs; the portions were bigger than I expected. It's $4 per side which is a little pricey but seeing as how it's a small business I didn't mind. Went at about 10-11am Saturday morning and I was seated as soon as I walked in, however it did start to fill up after that. The atmosphere was really nice for a calm Saturday morning. If I ever went back to Harlem I would definitely visit here again.

The food is delicious, the drinks are flowing and the team is so welcoming. I come for frittatas, yes, but I leave with a smile because of Jennifer and Daisy. See you every weekend, Home Sweet Harlem.

Came here for brunch. Great homemade style of food. Home skillet and Farmers skillet are on point! Mango Bellini's are delicious. Make sure to order yams as well. Unfortunately, the only negative was that the coffee was not so good but just order more Mango Bellini's and you'll be ok.  Enjoy!!!!
Beautiful black owned business, with a student discount, and sweet servers- my party had Jennifer and she was the sweetest.

The owner, Donna, is welcoming and friendly and the space is attractive. I had a great crimini mushroom omelette (which the chef customized using egg whites) with tasty crab cakes and a Mimosa made with freshly squeezed OJ. The combo (omelette, 2 sides, coffee/tea and mimosa) is a decent value.  My server was very attentive: They were out of skim milk for the latte I requested, so I just asked for a regular cup of coffee (which was good).  She offered to bring me several other milks, including almond milk.  When I settled on whole milk she brought it heated. A nice touch.
Place is very nice and relaxing, Staff was very friendly, Frittata was very good, Potatoes could use some more seasoning.
The food is amazing!  The owner is very courteous.  Brunch is my favorite, but I also love the pies and smoothies.  Been eating Donna's food for years. Very healthy and filling.  Highly recommend!

I saw Home Sweet Harlem while walking the neighborhood early one Saturday and decided it was worth a visit.  I am so glad I came back while they were open - my friends and I had a great dinner, it was a combination of good food and feeling like we were in somebody's home.  We will definitely be back.Highlights - homemade guacamole, freshly roasted chicken on the chicken Ceasar salad which was so good  you wouldn't even notice how fresh the lettuce was, black beans that were so nicely seasoned they almost outshined the shrimp!
The service was terrible and the food wasn't very good either. The chicken cutlet was good though. Won't be going back here.

What a wonderful place. The food, service and atmosphere were all top notch. Was able to talk to the owner (and compliment her unbelievable biscuits) and she is a sweet woman. Can't help but hope for her, and this restaurant, to succeed! Definitely get the grits and gravy.

My mom and I decided to stop by for brunch due to great reviews on Yelp. By all means did our experience live up to them. Our food was delicious and the service was great. I ordered their popular dish Farmer's Skillet and my mother had their griddle cakes. The owner/chef was kind enough to greet us and ask about our food/service. I will definitely come back to support a black business!
Great wine and good service! The owner was super friendly.

Went here for brunch on Father's Day with my family as 12 people (8 adults and 4 kids). Not that easy to find a place that will accept a reservation for 12 people for brunch. We had one person with a dairy allergy and one with a gluten allergy and they were extremely accommodating. Service was fantastic and the food was equally as good. I had the turkey and cheddar omelettes . Omelette was moist and tasty (hate dry omelettes). We shared the challah French toast and the cheese and fruit plate which were both delicious. The fruit smoothies were light and tasty! The comped us some drinks as a thank you for our business. My whole family loved it and helped contribute to a great Father's Day. We Will definitely be back.
Just had my first brunch here and ....biscuits are quite possibly the best I've ever  had with just a hint of cheddar.... and I chose the farmers skillet- I'll be back! Good crowd too!

As a former chef and foodie, my only complaint is that I have to bike up or walk up a huge hill no matter where I come from to get here! But that just makes the food even better than it already is! It's also VERY reasonably priced, bordering 'cheap' which is another reason I keep coming up this hill! The place is aptly named as it feels like home! The soups ( try the chicken peanut stew & the cheddar broccoli!) are delicious; hearty, healthy and memorable. The Cobb salad was perfection; marinated chicken with the house secret recipe has me hooked. But I've also had the tuna melt which doesn't sound like much but it's on a higher plane. Everything I've tried so far over my 4 it 5 times I've been here has been delicious. WW approved! The staff is very friendly, there is WiFi and the cappuccino is a favorite. The owner, Donna, keeps the menu fresh and has new specials all the time- she's a creative chef (which I appreciate) and always incorporates fresh herbs and spices which make everything a cut above. Its the details in decor, updated menus and real desire to bring healthy and delicious cuisine to Harlem that make this place "foodie-approved" im my opinion. I'll be back!

Came here on Christmas because I was hungry and it was the first place I saw. Food is so amazing and fresh...actually everything in the place is fresh from the food to the drinks. Our server messed up our order but was so nice and apologetic that we didn't even mind. Will come here again soon.
It was everything good, I had a delicious breakfast, and they have natural orange juice which I liked it more

The food is great and the owner is wonderful. Every time I come there I enjoy myself. My rating would be higher if the service was better. There were several times I came there and we weren't given utensils, the servers didn't check in, and on at least three occasions, they waited until we had finished our meals to let us know that the credit card machine wasn't working.
Still visiting from down under. Second place I've been in Harlem and I'm so happy. If you know any other good places in Harlem then yelp a brother out lol.

Let me start off by saying that I really, really wanted to LOVE this place. The first time I came here for lunch I was in love with the quaint atmosphere, cozy décor and the bumpin' R&B music coming through the speakers. I ordered a turkey cheeseburger with turkey bacon and loved it so much I came back two days later to try the shrimp and grits. They were delicious! I thought to myself that this will be my lunch spot for now on. Two weeks later I realized that I spoke way too soon. My colleague and I stopped in for lunch hoping for the shrimp and grits, only to be told that they did not have any shrimp or fish. The owner then states that she does have one piece of fish left and one of us could have that. Really?! Is that even a complete order? I order a turkey cheeseburger again along with a side of macaroni soufflé, my colleague orders something else. We wait...and wait...and wait. Why is it taking so long? No one is in the place but us. The burger was the most tasteless thing I have ever eaten. I think she made the patties and did not put any seasoning in them. The macaroni  was simply some leftover macaroni and cheese that was hard and dry. I immediately thought what is going on? I then overheard someone say that the chef wasn't in. I was like oh okay that's why this food tastes like crap!!! I return a few days later and order fish...again the food has no taste. It seems as though the only people there was the owner and her server, a young girl from Kentucky. Again the "real cook" wasn't there. After the last two visits I realized that I can only patronize this establishment if the cook is there. The owner is a very nice, quirky lady, but she can't cook.

Why did I not know about this place sooner??? Went for brunch...The food...amazing!! The service... amazing!! This place offers beautifully prepared food that is fresh and delicious. Kudos to Kalif the chef and his associate whose name I can't remember and our server Daisy who was always right there when giving us free wine and Bellini refills! Going back for Thursday night karaoke! This is a true neighborhood gem and people should definitely go there and see for yourself.
If you're looking for a cheap, decent sized meal this place is great. Cosy restaurant and great comfort food after a big day of exploring the city. Waiter was lovely as well.

My job brings in different restaurants for lunch every day. Today's restaurant was Home Sweet Harlem. The food was so incredibly good! I got a lemon herb chicken entree (lemon zest, garlic, oregano, parsley, sage, rosemary, kosher salt, scallions, and butter) with a cheese noodle soufflé and salad. The chicken was so tender, just absolutely mouthwateringly delicious! The cheese noodle soufflé was perfect! This is my first time trying food from Home Sweet Harlem. I can't wait to go to the restaurant and try the rest of their menu!

Overall, great experience. Went for brunch with manfriend; we both got a $20 deal that came with brunch beverage or choice of fresh squeezed OJ. I got cremini mushroom frittata with yams and a moan-worthy cheese, flavor was sublime, also chose grits as a side which were very yummy, some sort of meat thing cooked with for seasoning( maybe a chicken liver) not sure, didn't eat that part but it had great flavor, also came with a light thin biscuit, very flaky and so happy it was very small because this was so much food, also came with a little portion of mixed salad, AND salmon cake, it was nice  but it's not rave-worthy. A little on the dry side and reminiscent of tuna texture. The man got a spinach feta omelet which was tasty but relatively small compared to I guess a normal brunch omelet. Definitely go with the frittata and you won't be disappointed! Also we chose the mimosas and they were very well balanced between booze & juice. Now for the place: LOVE the interior, good amount of seating, awesome art work all over the place, service was very friendly and welcoming, a HUGE group walked in right before us and the staff had the foresight to warn us to order quickly so we could get our order in before theirs! AC was perfect to keep us comfy from the crazy heat and I'm just happy it's so close to home. Will definitely return!
Love this spot in our neighborhood.  Sautéed kale is my favorite dish, followed by griddle cakes with a side of turkey sausage.  The vibe is very friendly.  Must try a glass of pinotage wine!

Came here for brunch and the good and coffee were both very good.  The space itself is beautiful, with exposed brick and great lighting.  I had the Frittata and my friend had the French Toast.  Both were excellent and good portions.  The service was earnest, if a little inexperienced.  The only critique is that brunch was pretty expensive for the area - $20 a person not including alcohol.
Really solid brunch, amazing micheladas. Ordered the shrimp and grits and skillet and both were great. Will definitely be back!

I may go back and try this place a second time to see how they do, but here is my experience:Pros: The owner and waiter were extremely nice. Super accomodating and friendly. The food we ate (turkey burgers) was also pretty tasty. The decor is nice and they have a nice, big space.Cons: The service was really, unbearably slow, even though the place was almost empty. We wanted to order appetizers but we wound up just getting dinner because we could tell that it would take forever for anything to arrive. The menu is also really limited...I would use this as more of a lunchtime place for salads/sandwiches than a dinner option. I am interested in trying the brunch, though, and might consider trying it once more. Also the dinner option I was most interested in was unavailable for the night, so in addition to a tiny dinner menu, some of it wasn't available.I think this place has a lot of potential but they need to amp up their service (and also order real menus..their menu is printed on computer paper).EDIT ON 5.27.2014: I went back with some friends for brunch. Again, the food was very good and the servers were very attentive. I would add back in a star for faster service (much more reasonable this time), but would have to take it back out again for these two issues: 1. Brunch was a bit overpriced for what we got...$12 for a bowl of Muesli is a bit much.  2. Two people at my table ordered a sausage-biscuit sandwich thing, but one person's was missing the top biscuit for some reason. There was also a weird moment of tension where a group of servers stood near our table and seemed to be having a light argument over something. So I'm keeping at three stars.

Great food! This place looks like nothing from the outside, but the inside is a breath of fresh southern air! Shrimp and grits, and French toast bigger than I have ever seen it! Such good food for a decent price, and our server was a doll!

I went here to meet a friend for breakfast last week. I was one of the first customers there and was greeted by  the server, William. He was very friendly and personable as we chatted while I waited for my friend to arrive. Once she arrived I ordered the vegetarian burrito w/ chipotle mayo on the side. I don't eat eggs so they substituted it with more black beans and avocado. I was very satisfied with the taste and presentation. The chipotle gave my burrito a nice level of spice that meshed well with the burrito.  My friend had salmon cakes, veggie omelet, and grits which was fresh and tasted good(she's a foodie plus she finished her plate, good sign) ..made me even hungrier. Our bill was under $25 so it was time and money well spent. William and the owner of Home  Sweet Home made sure our meal was to ur liking, which it was.I'll definitely be coming back more often for brunch or to try some of their other breakfast dishes. Good price and good food in NYC, that's a win-win.
Mediocre at best.  Horrible service with a ridiculous wait time considering we are the only people here. Plus I didn't know that it was possible to make a griddle cake with absolutely zero flavor.

So excited to have this charming spot in my new neighborhood! Previously, I picked up coffees to go (they have milk alternatives for lactose intolerant folks like me), but today, I needed internet for a project (mine was down). Not only were they open on a holiday, they were so lovely and the food was so delicious.Looking forward to bringing my friend's here for brunch!
I've come twice for the French toast. It's delicious!! The workers are great, and the service is quick.
Came here with my coworkers during lunch.  We both orders the turkey sandwich which came out ok but was a little too plain for my taste.  Not a bad meal but not worth the walk to this location.
Very good food, relaxed atmosphere, reasonably priced and extremely friendly staff. A neighborhood gem!

Hands down the most genuinely nice people working there. They were so passionate about their establishment and the food accompanied by it. I had a breakfast burrito and my girlfriend had the gumbo soup with a sandwich. Everything was incredible. Can't wait to go back!

The place was pretty empty for brunch on a Saturday. The staff was very friendly, checking to see if we needed anything and asking how the food was. The food was good. I originally ordered the waffle with fried chicken cutlet (I'm from the south) and the owner came back a saying that their waffle iron was new and it wasn't ready to be used yet. So I got the pancakes. They were good, I could tell the batter was from scratch. The chicken had been fresh fried in a light seasoned batter. Together it was comfort food. $12 for the pancakes and coffee (or tea) plus $4 for the cutlet. Expensive in my opinion but it's Manhattan and it was tasty. The friendly service was icing on the cake. I will likely come back if I'm ever in the area again.

Such a cute spot for brunch with friends and family! Bright, spacious, close to the 137th-City College stop on the 1 train. The staff is attentive and the owner is very friendly. The challah french toast was delicious with yogurt and strawberries, and I had a few bites of the frittata and turkey sausage and everyone in my party was happy with their meal!  The coffee is also delicious-- the staff whipped up the half and half cream which was pretty wonderful!

Just had brunch the food was only ok. The biscuit was cold and hard. The salmon cake was cold. My grandson had to wait over fifteen minutes for bacon that was ordered. He received his griddle cakes way before receiving the bacon. They need more wait staff and there was some flies.

We came for a late brunch here on Saturday and LOVED it. I had griddle cakes with berries, and homemade chicken apple sausage - both were RIDICULOUSly delicious. My boyf had sausage egg and cheese on a biscuit and swore it was the best biscuit he's ever eaten. It was comfortable, cool and cozy. We were there at a weird time so it wasn't crazy busy, and we had a great time chatting with the hostess and servers. Donna, the owner, even came over to make we were happy.One thing: Google will tell you that it's on Fred Doug Blvd but it's NOT, it's on Amsterdam. Luckily it was totally worth the hike!

Service is slooow on a packed Saturday brunch day. 15 min to get coffee. Another 45 min to get food. I ordered a Farmer's Skillet that was dried up and over salted (and isn't it supposed to be served in a skillet?). The salad was old and limp. My boyfriend ordered the muesli, not warm like we expected, but COLD! Dry oats in a bowl with fruits took 45 min to make? Menu doesn't even specify that it's not cooked. Anything with oatmeal, people will assume is hot. And we weren't given a disclaimer by the server. The waitress (owner?) was unapologetic and made it seem like we were in the wrong, pushing us to order something else when the meal should've been comped after making us wait for so long. Also, the waiter never followed through on getting me ketchup and hot sauce. Furthermore, the same waitress asked us if were leaving when we just got in. Like, you don't even know your own customers? Not even that huge of a restaurant. The bathroom is disgusting and if it was in that state I don't even want to see the kitchen!
AMAZING pancakes!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! and outstanding service. I cannot wait to go back!

If real home cooking is your thing, this is your place.  The food is all home cooking (by Donna, the owner) and utterly delicious. We stopped in for breakfast, and both ended up ordering the Home Skillet, which gives new meaning to mouth watering.  Home cooking takes a little longer, so if you are in a rush or the impatient type, save this place for when you have time. Be prepared to linger over your meal. Everything here, however, is worth the wait.  Before ordering, we were served water automatically, and offered a cup of good, hot coffee, which arrived at the table along with ketchup and hot sauce for our meal, served elegantly in small cups.  Our dishes came with a choice of two kinds of roasted potatoes (herbed russets or yams), or 4 kinds of grits, and a small green salad, and homemade biscuit.  I ordered the yams, and by accident ended up with both potato varieties, both of which turned out to be melt in your mouth wonderful.  My other half ordered the grits and gravy, which he pronounced lip smacking.  The ambiance in the restaurant is charming and warm, made warmer for us by the happy advent of an extended conversation with the owner.  There is live music on several evenings, and a ladies night in their schedule.  We loved the whole thing, and plan to come back for other things, and check out the dinner menu!

A little gem in my neighborhood. Not many places in Harlem serve food made with organic ingredients. And freshly squeezed juices. This place is a great brunch spot. The service was very attentive. Was even greeted by the owner and cook. I will definanly go back.

Overpriced on everything. They tried to charge me $12 for a bagel and when I complained it went down to $4. I ordered muesli and it was dry and fit for farm animals. It was basically farm feed. My friends son ordered their famous grits with eggs. The entire dish tasted and looked as if it came from a instant microwaveable food. Their only saving grace was the fried chicken and pancakes that my son ordered but the waiting time for all this was nearly an hour. It felt as though they took their time to raise and grow all the ingredients for our food. I would give this establishment 0 stars but I am unable to without giving at least one.

Had brunch here with our 8 month old and some friends with their baby after the blizzard. I called ahead to see if they were open before hand and at the time were not. Donna the owner called me back twice! Once to let me know they were going to open and a second time  that they had staff and would have a table ready for us if we still wanted to go. Amazing customer service on her part. Food was good, Donna actually made it herself as she was the only cook. The service was a little lacking but I'm sure that's because they were understaffed, but our waiter was still very polite.

I visited this place on two separate occasions. The first time it was lackluster but tolerable. I thought it was me, because I like things a certain way. The second time it was bad! We we were seated Expeditiously, no problem. My daughter and I each order a skillet, mine is shrimp and hers sausage. Our food arrives and we begin eating. Don't live it but ok. Then I realize that I haven't come across a shrimp! I explain this to the waiter, he says oh I switched your orders. No problem we are family we just swap the plates. I came across one shrimp btw! This dish comes with salad. However the salad was brown. We did not eat it. I can tolerate waiting, mistakes etc. shit happens. When you serve people brown salad, that means you really do not care and I can not return to this place! I do not recommend it!

I checked out Home Sweet Harlem for Sunday brunch. I didn't have to wait at all to be seated. I sat at the bar and had a lovely conversation with the guy who took my order and fixed my drink. But the best part was yet to come. I ordered the shrimp and grits, which came with eggs, stewed tomatoes, a homemade flaky buscuit, tea, and a bellini. They were out of shrimp and were able to substitute with fish. The dish was prepared to perfection and every part of the dish was outrageously delicious! I met the owner who cooked my food and she was great too, just like her staff. This restaurant is the best kept secret in Harlem!

My sweetheart and I had brunch here today. We really enjoyed the food and hospitality.  They provide you with a descent amount of food of filling food. The wait for the food and Mimosas were on point.  The food was seasoned just right. Comfortable atmosphere for a Sunday brunch, not crowd at all.  The only thing I did not like were the unlimited Mimosas for just one hour. It should be extended for a least two hours. However, I will definitely go again.
I love the food. I had a burger with the sweet potatoes, delicious. I had a very pleasant and attentive server name Shaniah. I will recommend this restaurant to all my coworkers and family.

My mom and I were staying in the area and stopped in for breakfast on a Saturday. What a gem! The biscuit sandwich was seriously the best I have had. The biscuit was so tender and flaky. Eggs cooked and seasoned perfectly. My mom had the rosemary potatoes and I had the grits and gravy. Both were wonderful accompaniments and perfectly done. Service was so friendly and attentive. The owner sat and talked to us and was very kind, intelligent and thoughtful. Highly recommended!

Few places in Harlem are more inviting and welcoming than this gem.  I appreciate a good brunch and Home Sweet Harlem has one of the best I've ever been to.  The frittatas are super tasty and the french toast is quite savory.  The portions are sizeable and will keep you stuffed for the day and give you the right base if you decide to imbibe in the bottomless drinks, which I encourage you to do.  The customer service is a delight and very attentive.  I enjoy this place so much that I often take out of town guests and family members here since I know whatever they have will be tasty and their experiences will be exceptional.  Glad to live nearby this place.

Found this restaurant on Yelp as I was looking for a restaurant in Harlem that served a slightly healthier brunch (aka no soul food). E and I walked into the restaurant and there were about 4-5 other diners there. There was no hostess or wait-staff to greet us so we just grabbed one of the empty tables while catching the eye of a waiter. We sat there waiting...and waiting..and waiting for menus. Weird because the restaurant was pretty empty and I knew the waiter saw us grabbing the table. Finally I hail him down and he tells us that we can't actually dine there because they were expecting a church group. The owner then came out and offered for us to sit at a bar, by the door. We were ok with this since we were waiting for our other friend to arrive so moved to the bar area. However, the door was left open and I asked them to close it because it was a rainy and cool day. They refused to accommodate this request even though the restaurant was empty and it was very chilly by the door. So with everything combined, we decided to just forget dining there and left. It was obvious they didn't want us there and why force our patronage on a restaurant? So we went to Trufa and had a pretty delicious brunch instead. Avoid, particularly if its a Sunday!
Excellent service and food! The brunch menu has a good variety of choices. Everything I eat was very fresh.

I have recently visited this location again as i have been many times before even celebrated a birthday here. However things have changed Daisy isn't there anymore (Sad). My waitress was not so pleasant and had a bit lack luster service. She spent more time just looking around instead of serving and keeping up with her tables. We ordered unlimited mimosas and if it weren't for the only delightful person that day Mavelin we would've probably only got 1 or 2 refills. When she seen we were in need of anything she gracefully came from the bar to assist us as our waitress was no where around for 15 min at a time. Mavelin was such a delight that she was the only reason that made our experience positive great energy,great service and great conversation. The unfortunate pat was after our meal and drinks was completely done our original waitress decided to come over and explain that she had a long day or she would've been better.... someone teach Jennifer that in the service business the "The Time is Now" not next time. As we were wrapping up we could see and hear the bus boy and waitress cursing and yelling at Mavelin instead of focusing on the guests like professionals. Four stars just for Mavelin and the food!
Daisy is such a pleasure. She makes an outstanding sangria!  I was recommended by a friend and then I recommended a friend and now that friend is recommending friends. See you soon guys!

This was a joke! First of all, we had to step up to enter, so disable individuals were NOT welcome. We were NOT seated in the ONLY booth because we were told it was "reserved" for a party of five. Our waitress was uninformed, and the answers to any questions should have been, "I don't know, but I'll find out." Instead, she simply answered, "I don't know." When we were forced to sit at a particular table, we thought perhaps we could still get on with our meal. When four vanilla people came in well after us, their order taken, and then served while we still waited, we simply left cash for the drinks on our table and left.  Even if the food is good, it's not worth being disrespected and ignored. Perhaps it's only to serve City College people? It is very clear the people of color are not welcome.
This is a great little spot to grab brunch with the girls or with a new boo. Good food. Very nice owner. Service varies, but mostly good.

This restaurant is, in my view, the crown jewel of the neighborhood.  I teach across the street at City College, and I've been waiting a long time for a place like Home-sweet-harlem to open.   It's in the location that used to be the restaurant "La Pregunta".  But H.Sw.Harlem. is on a different level altogether.  When you order a coffee, they ask if you want steamed milk.  (Not just for espresso drinks, even with regular coffee!)   The coffee (and espresso) are excellent.      I haven't sampled all of the food on the menu, but I can say that the soups are amazing.  I've had the  Curry Lentil soup (really special) and the Turkey Chili (also excellent).  As you know from the earlier reviews, the staff are wonderful, and the layout of the place is charming.   The general motif of the menu is 'healthy-eating' but also 'delicious'.  This is a winner.

Omg....where do is START! This place is absolutely incredible! From the food, to the service, to the Vibe. I came here not knowing what to expect. I was visiting Harlem, staying in an Airbnb, debating on whether or not I wanted to move to the area. I found the restaurant on yelp and the reviews were good. So decided to go for brunch. The staff was overwhelmingly gracious and welcoming. It was an unexpectedly amazing way to start my morning. The owner literally personally grilled me up the best shrimp and grits to ever grace my taste buds!!! I'm talking overwhelmingly delicious. I was eating alone and she witnessed my enthusiasm while eating the food, and asked to join me for a few minutes. Now, me not being from the area and thinking of moving to the area was completely enthused at the fact that owner of this establishment with such excellent food wanted to sit with me and chat me up over her cooking. She joined and I got to know her a bit. And what a GEM! She is super passionate about her business and the impact that she wants to have with her clientele. Her passion was inspiring. I decided in that moment that Harlem was the place for me!! Thank you Home Sweet Harlem for keeping the true spirit of Harlem and hospitality alive in your establishment. I suggest that anyone in the area who wants to have some good home cooking at amazing prices to come here. You won't regret it!!!!

This place is da bomb. Stopped in for brunch and left very satisfied. Had the Farmers breakfast fritata with grits and a biscuit. All were on point. The biscuit was light and flaky.  The grits were wonderfully creamy and the frititta is a well balanced blend of egg, cheese and potatoes in a light pastry shell. Our host, Donna, is very friendly and welcoming and the perfect addition to a great visit.

nice little coffee shop with wifi and the food is really good and the cook is a sweet heart!! if i lived closer i would go be there all the time to just relax and get something too eat before i go home............im going back for sure

I went with my friend on Sunday morning for brunch. I ordered the shrimp & grits w/ turkey sausage, oj & coffee & my friend ordered the frittata with a side of salmon cakes, Arnold Palmer & coffee. The service was terrible- a group of 4 walked in 15 mins after us & was immediately given water & mimosas; I had to ask for water. Food came- shrimp & grits were ok, sausage was too sweet- very average food. I was never given a spoon for my coffee & had to ask for it. Biscuit was bad. My friend said her salmon cakes tasted like they were out of a can, she received a lemonade instead of an Arnold Palmer &  the lemonade had a medicinal taste ( they exchanged it for a sweet tea); her frittata was ok and was very rustic with largely chopped veggies. My friend asked for butter for her biscuit 3 times & I asked for my oj 3 times. I don't know if it was an off day for them, but I would not recommend this place & would never go back. I hope they read this & improve their service & food.  It definitely was not worth $20 for each entree.

Great brunch spot.  We had an excellent meal with great service.  I got the pancakes, eggs, salmon cakes and greek yogurt with bananas.  The pancakes were delicious and everything was properly cooked.  My girlfriend got the farmer's skillet which was a fluffy egg frittata with a good portion of turkey sausage and potatoes, red peppers and onions.  Very, very tasty.  Plus, they refilled my coffee as much as I wanted, which is a huge plus in my book.  All in all, will definitely be back.

Food was ok, nothing remarkable. Service was terrible. Many of the dishes our table ordered were inaccurate or not delivered at all. Here for lunch with only two other tables, but the waiter was really overwhelmed.

I love this place! It's become my home away from home. I am in Harlem a lot bug usually on 8th ave but I make a special trip to go here to just say hi and grab a bite to eat. Love the soups and I can't wait to see what the spring and summer holds for this hidden Harlem gem. Say hello to Donna the owner. She's the best!

Instant regret. Water tasted horrible, horrible service, utensiles looks like they weren't washed, and the turn around for food.... don't  waste your time. You will be disappointed. Utterly disappointed.

Delicious food every time! I love the cheese and noodle souffle. I have been here a couple times for dinner, once bringing a group of 40 for an event. They were helpful, accommodating and gracious. Another time I planned to meet some colleagues here for dinner and they were closing but actually opened up their doors and stayed open for us. If that's not customer service I don't know what is!

Been here a couple of times, the food is good! I had the best buffalo wings I've ever tasted here (though unfortunately they are no longer on the menu, but there's plenty of other good food to make up for that). I ordered the St Nicholas burger just earlier today. The restaurant doesn't serve anything that walks on four legs, so it was a turkey burger. Came with turkey bacon, herb cheddar, grilled onions, romaine lettuce and tomato on a brioche bun with a side of baked sweet potatoes. My friend had a similar burger with cream cheese (unusual condiment for a burger and he liked it) and a side of baked potatoes, and we had a glass of fresh homemade lemonade on the side. The space is well-lit with exposed brick walls and folk art paintings hung all around the place. The staff are super friendly and gracious, including the owner who clearly takes pride in serving great food and will go out of her way to make sure you are satisfied IF YOU TALK TO HER!!! My friend and I had lunch and stuck around for another good 40 minutes after we ate studying and they were cool with it. Displeased yelpers who left bad reviews below could have easily remedied their issues if they had just spoken up. I never understood why people will take their complaints to yelp instead of actually trying to resolve them, valid or not. I will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu. I was looking over at the table next to mine and they were having some tasty-looking avocado dish, so I'll probably order that next.

As I was walking towards CCNY (City College), I suddendly bumped into the place. I walked in, and the environment was super low key, quiet and very neat with a friendly staff. Great music choice; nothing crazy, over the top or loud, that you can't establish a good communication with whomever is there with you (like in must places in NYC). But let's cut to the chase, I went with the lunch option of a turkey burger with baked potatoes and I finished it off with a homemade piece of sweet potato pie. I was stunt! The food was done just right with the perfect touch of flavor. Every item placed in my burger, in the potatoes and in the pie was totally fresh and truly organic. The freshness of the food and the cook's hands it's a slamming combo. Some people ask a lot for their buck, but I am only interested on quality not quantity. With this said, I believe the serving size at this location is a nice normal portion that definitely does justice for its price, quality and flavor. Two thumbs up!

Came to this place for breakfast on a weekday. The staff was absolutely amazing. They were very sweet and very attentive. The food was also pretty great and I definitely plan on coming back here again sometime soon. I do feel like it is a little pricey for breakfast food but every now and then it doesn't hurt.

I fell in love with this place when I walked in.. The staff is super sweet and the dining area is so cozy and homey. I felt like I was eating my Grandma's food. It was on the heavy side but in a good way! prices are great as well...

This place was hands down my favorite place in New York. The staff is ridiculously friendly and the food is delicious! They were really welcoming and we ate here 4/9 days. You know the food is good when you keep going back even though your visiting a new city that has countless options! They were also incredibly kind as they let me park myself and my two huge pieces of luggage inside while we waited for a few hours until it was time to go to the airport. Recommendations: Challah French Toast and a Latte (seriously best latte in New York, and I'm picky!).

When we first arrived at 10:30 a.m., having read that the restaurant opened at 10, they were closed.  A woman came to the door and said rather brusquely that they were accommodating a catering order, and they would possibly be open by 11.  We wandered over to the Hamilton Grange, had a tour and enjoyed the park, and then, since it was on our way anyway, a few minutes after Noon, we returned to Home Sweet Harlem, which was JUST opening,  Business quickly picked up -it was clear that other customers had been awaiting the opening - and the single waitress/hostess was already running behind.  The cook came out to tell us they were running slowly, that they apologized.  But no offer was made to sweeten our experience or to mitigate what felt like a blow-off by the waitress.  HOWEVER, though the food did take an inordinate amount of time to get to us, it was superb.  The coffee, which is included in the price of the food,  is delicious, and the fritattas we ordered were perfect, served with a choice of grits/gravy or potatoes or sweet potatoes.  (I had sweet potatoes, which were done to perfection, and my friend had grits with the gravy, which she judged as excellent as well).  I have not had as good or as reasonably priced a brunch in a very long time.  I sure hope this restaurant gets its act together in terms of customer service because the food is truly exceptional.  My advice to anyone heading over there is that you call first and make sure they are open.  Unfortunately, there is probably no way to ensure that you will be served quickly, so go prepared to be patient. . . .

Amazing Food and atmosphere!  They have a really sweet staff. Have had dinner and brunch there and have been more than satisfied each time. The only reason I did not give them 5 stars is because sometimes the staff can be a bit forgetful with minor things, but they are truly a sweet and polite bunch.

You're better off popping into  a cheap chain restaurant. Very ordinary cuisine at extraordinary prices, slow service, a misleading menu and ridiculously poor value for money. If you're not overly particular, ihop could provide the same meal with more bang for your buck. If you'd like to get what you pay for, head over to Malcolm X Blvd and roll a dice. I promise, any place will be better. Extremely disappointed with my $23 brunch that added up to 3 regular pancakes, scrambled eggs, ONE sausage link and a flute of pastuerized orange juice (not the freshly squeezed OJ that they advertise).

Cute atmosphere, GREAT MUSIC, great food...HORRIBLE SERVICE. I almost never leave reviews like this but I must of had the worst waitress in the world when I ate here. It took at least 5 minutes for her to come over and greet us, and when she did she awkwardly asked us how we were and then said she would be back with waters...5 minutes later she comes back with two waters (there were three of us) we told her we needed some time even though she looked like she had no interest in taking our orders. 10 minutes later we order and get our food in a timely manner. And that was the last I saw of our waitress. All three of us had to get up and walk to the counter to get coffee and water refills. We literally waited 40+ minutes (after we had finished) to get a bill and a take out box. And we still had to get up and flag down another employee for the box. She was still in the store, I could see her walking around, sitting down, and wiping off random tables while we ate but she never came back over to our table except to bring us the bill after we all stood up, put on coats on and waited. I wish I knew her name.

One afternoon, a few of my friends and a few staff members from my old high school decided to try Home Sweet Harlem. We checked the reviews on Yelp and they had great reviews and ratings so we were ecstatic about trying out this place to eat. As soon as we entered, the place was awkwardly empty. Two people in my party had ordered something on the menu and they were all out. Our food came out at different times, and the St. Nick Park burger (which had been recommend) was tiny, cold, and the grilled onions were barely cooked! My friend and I ordered shrimp that contained brown rice and the rice was not even cooked all the way! I asked the waiter about the rice and he said it was supposed to be crispy. If I wanted crispy brown rice I would have asked, however that was not an option on the menu.  Twice we asked for glasses of water and our waiter kept forgetting! Not only that, he seemed confused the whole time we kept asking him questions about the food. The automatic gratuity that they added was overpriced and nowhere near what the waiter deserved. I give this place 2 stars. B for effort and a C for semi-good food.
